instructions.text: Bake shell 10 minutes at 425°F (220°C); drain spinach and press out liquid.
Saute onion in oleo; add cream. (Scald till fine bubbles at edge.)
Beat eggs with salt, basil, nutmeg, and pepper; add Ricotta.
Beat until blended; add hot cream/spinach to egg/Ricotta mixture.
Mix well; pour into baked shell. Return to oven.
Bake below oven center about 35 minutes at 350°F (175°C), just until set.
Cool to lukewarm before cutting. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Meat and Potato Quiche
recipes.description: Hearty quiche with shredded potato crust.

instructions.text: Press potatoes, oil, and onions into a 9 inch pie plate like a crust.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 15 minutes.
Layer cheese and meat over crust.
Mix milk, eggs, and seasonings together well and pour over meat.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 30 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Oyster Rockafella Quiche
recipes.description: Easy quiche with smoked oysters and bacon.

ingredients.item: grated Cheddar cheese or Monterey Jack

instructions.text: Cook bacon (I like to cook it in the microwave). Set aside.
Cook spinach in microwave; drain.
In large bowl, add all the ingredients; mix well with fork.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake in 400°F (200°C) oven for about 35 minutes, or until a knife comes out clean.
Serves 4.

recipes.title: Veggie Delight Quiche
recipes.description: Vegetable quiche with broccoli and two cheeses.

instructions.text: Mix cheeses in large mixing bowl with hand mixer.
Add eggs and mix well.
Fold in remaining ingredients and pour into shells.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 15 minutes, then lower to 325°F (165°C) for 45 minutes, or until golden brown.
Let cool for 15 minutes, until slicing or serving, then sit back and enjoy!

recipes.title: Crustless Quiche
recipes.description: Easy crustless quiche with sausage and broccoli.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease 9 or 10 inch deep pie plate.
Sprinkle sausage, cheese, onion, and broccoli over bottom of pie plate.
Place remaining ingredients in blender container. Cover and blend on high speed 1 minute.
Pour into pie plate.
Bake until golden brown and knife inserted in center comes out clean, 50 to 55 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes before cutting. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

notes: Tip: To make ahead, cover and refrigerate for up to 3 hours. Bake 30 to 35 minutes.

recipes.title: Hamburger Quiche
recipes.description: Hearty ground beef quiche.

instructions.text: Brown meat in skillet. Drain fat and put in bottom of pie shell.
Blend mayonnaise, milk, eggs, and cornstarch until smooth.
Add cheese, onion, and pepper.
Pour into pastry shell on top of beef.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 35 to 40 minutes, until knife inserted in center comes out clean.

recipes.title: Impossible Quiche
recipes.description: Easy crustless quiche that makes its own crust.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F (200°C). Lightly grease pie plate, 10 x 1 1/2 inches.
Mix broccoli, mushrooms and cheese in pie plate.
Beat remaining ingredients 15 seconds in blender or 1 minute at high speed on hand mixer.
Pour into pie plate.
Bake until golden brown and knife inserted comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes before cutting.

notes: Can use spinach, bacon, or whatever you like.

recipes.title: Surprise Cake
recipes.description: Easy cake with cream cheese and Dream Whip topping.

ingredients.item: cherry pie filling or other fruit topping

instructions.text: Take first 3 ingredients and use hands to mix and spread in 8x8 inch pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 28 minutes.
Take next 2 ingredients and mix. Combine with 1 (8 ounce) Dream Whip and spread on cake while hot.
Spread with cherry pie filling or other fruit topping.

recipes.title: Zucchini Cake
recipes.description: Moist zucchini cake - no frosting needed.

instructions.text: Combine eggs, oil, vanilla, sugar, and zucchini.
Add dry ingredients. Beat well.
Bake in ungreased 9x13 inch pan for 45 minutes at 350°F (175°C).
No frosting needed - sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.

recipes.title: Apple-Nut Coffee Cake
recipes.description: Moist coffee cake with apples, nuts, and cinnamon topping.

instructions.text: Grease pan with shortening.
In medium bowl, stir flour, baking powder, soda, and salt.
In large bowl, use spoon to beat together sugar and shortening till fluffy.
Beat in egg and vanilla till well mixed.
Peel apple; chop it up. Stir half the flour mixture into the sugar mixture.
Stir in sour cream. Stir rest of flour mixture. Stir in chopped apple.
Spread in pan.
Crush nuts; put in small bowl. Mix brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon.
Sprinkle over coffee cake.
Turn oven to 350°F (175°C). Bake 25 to 30 minutes, or till done.
Hint - serve warm.

notes: Best served warm

recipes.title: Cranberry-Cheese Coffee Cakes
recipes.description: Yeast coffee cake with cranberry filling.

ingredients.item: grated lemon peel or almond extract

instructions.text: Prepare yeast dough according to package directions with flour, sugar, salt, shortening, water, milk, and egg.
Let rise. Roll out and fill with cranberry sauce mixed with lemon peel or almond extract.
Shape, let rise, and bake according to yeast bread instructions.

notes: Recipe continues from previous page

flags: partial recipe visible

recipes.title: Lemon Cake
recipes.description: Easy lemon cake mix cake with apricot nectar.

instructions.text: Mix ingredients for cake and beat on high for 2 minutes.
Pour in greased and floured pan and bake in 300°F (150°C) oven.
Bake in 13x9 inch pan for 35 minutes, or tube pan for 1 hour.

notes: Icing: 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 3 tbsp lemon juice. Mix icing ingredients and drizzle on cooled cake.

recipes.title: Lemon Surprise
recipes.description: Layered lemon pudding dessert with cream cheese.

instructions.text: Mix flour and oleo together and spread in a 9x13 inch ungreased pan.
Press firmly to form a solid crust. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes and cool.
Mix together cream cheese and sugar until fluffy; add 1 cup Cool Whip and mix well.
Spread over crust.
Mix until thick, instant pudding and milk.
Spread over cream cheese layer, then cover pudding with remaining Cool Whip.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

recipes.title: Sour Cream Nut Pound Cake
recipes.description: Rich pound cake with pecan-cinnamon swirl.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating 30 seconds after each.
Separately, combine flour, soda, and salt. Stir 1/3 flour into butter mixture and mix with spoon.
Add 1/2 sour cream; mix 1/3 flour, mix rest of sour cream.
Stir remaining flour and vanilla; mix well.
Combine ingredients in topping: 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 2 tsp sugar.
Sprinkle 1/3 of topping in greased and floured tube or Bundt pan.
Pour 1/2 cake batter over topping, 1/3 topping mixture, rest of cake batter, top with remaining topping.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 1 1/2 hours. Invert cake to cool.

notes: Topping: 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 2 tsp sugar

recipes.title: Chocolate Cake Roll
recipes.description: Light chocolate sponge cake rolled with ice cream filling.

instructions.text: Beat eggs and vanilla until fluffy. Add sugar gradually and beat until thick.
Sift dry ingredients over egg mixture and fold in with rubber spatula.
Spread into jelly roll pan that has been greased and lined with greased wax paper.
Bake 10 minutes at 350°F (175°C), or till toothpick comes out clean when testing.
Turn cake upside down on rack that is covered with a linen towel generously sprinkled with confectioners sugar.
Let stand a few minutes and then peel off wax paper and sprinkle with confectioners sugar.
Roll up. Let cake roll cool before filling.

notes: Ice Cream Filling: Beat egg whites with cream of tartar and sugar. Unroll cake and spread with ice cream. Roll up cake and spread top and sides with whipped egg whites. Brown in broiler. (For kids, you can use marshmallow cream.)

recipes.title: Golden Delicious Apple Cake
recipes.description: Moist apple cake with cinnamon and nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Beat butter, sugar, eggs, and water together.
Stir in flour, soda, salt, and spices.
Add vanilla, apples, and 1/2 cup nuts. Mix thoroughly.
Pour into well greased and floured 13x9 inch pan.
Sprinkle top with 1/3 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup nuts.
Bake 55 minutes at 350°F (175°C), serve with ice cream.
Serves 16.

recipes.title: Jewish Apple Cake
recipes.description: Traditional layered apple cake with cinnamon-sugar apples.

instructions.text: Combine flour and baking powder; add to other ingredients and mix well.
Pour half of batter into greased and floured tube pan.
Place apple mixture (apples tossed with sugar and cinnamon) in center and top with other half of batter.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1 1/2 hours.

recipes.title: Crazy Cake
recipes.description: Easy chocolate cake mixed right in the pan - no eggs needed.

instructions.text: Mix ingredients in a large bowl; place in a 9 inch oblong cake pan.
Cook at 350°F (175°C) for about 45 minutes.
Check with knife; if done, knife will come clean.
Let cool until warm to touch.
Spread peanut butter on top; let cool for a couple hours, then top off with Three Minute Fudge.
This was passed down from Greg's Mom, Fran Baker, to me. Makes 15 to 20 servings.
Begin early in day.

notes: Use 1/8 of the recipe for the cake - handwritten note on original

recipes.title: Fresh Orange Loaf Cake
recipes.description: Moist orange-flavored loaf cake.

instructions.text: Beat all ingredients, except eggs, for 2 minutes.
Add 2 eggs. Beat well.
Pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for approximately 1 hour (or till knife comes out clean when inserted in center of loaf).
Cool.

recipes.title: Filling for Chocolate Cake Roll - German Chocolate
recipes.description: Rich German chocolate filling with coconut and pecans.

instructions.text: Place butter, egg yolks, and milk in double boiler and cook over water till thick.
Add pecans and coconut. Cool slightly.
Unroll cake and spread with whipped cream.
Roll up and spread milk mixture on top and sides.

recipes.title: Banana Split Cake
recipes.description: No-bake layered dessert with graham cracker crust and fruit.

instructions.text: Spread cracker crumbs on bottom of pan. Melt margarine; pour over crumbs. Pat down.
Mix milk and lemon juice and spread over crumbs.
Cut up bananas and place in pan.
Drain pineapple and put over bananas.
Cover with Cool Whip.
Top with chopped nuts, cherries, etc.
Cool in refrigerator 1 to 2 hours.

recipes.title: Chocolate Eclair Cake
recipes.description: No-bake layered dessert with graham crackers and pudding.

instructions.text: Use 9x13 inch pan. Line bottom of ungreased 9x13 inch pan with single layer of graham crackers.
Mix pudding and milk until thickened. Blend in Cool Whip.
Spread 1/2 mixture on graham crackers.
Add a second layer of crackers and top with rest of pudding mixture.
Add a third layer of graham crackers.
Warm frosting in microwave 30 seconds to make more spreadable and frost top layer of crackers.
Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving to soften crackers, overnight is fine.

recipes.title: Chocolate Mayonnaise Cake with Chocolate Fudge Icing
recipes.description: Moist chocolate cake made with mayonnaise.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda and powder, and cocoa.
In a separate bowl, mix together cold water, mayonnaise, vanilla, then add this to dry ingredients and blend well.
Pour into 9x13 inch greased and floured pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25 to 30 minutes.

notes: Icing: 1 cup sugar, 1/4 cup cocoa, 1/4 cup milk, 1/4 cup butter, 2 tsp vanilla (add later). Bring ingredients to a boil in saucepan and boil exactly 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from flame. Add 2 teaspoons vanilla and cool slightly. Beat until spreading consistency.

recipes.title: Orange Juice Cookies
recipes.description: Soft orange-flavored drop cookies with orange icing.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Mix in eggs, orange juice, and orange peel.
Add flour and baking soda. Fold in nuts.
Drop by teaspoonful on baking sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool.

notes: Icing: 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 3 tbsp butter (room temperature), 1 1/2 tbsp orange juice, 2 tsp grated orange peel. Blend in medium bowl until smooth. Frost cookies.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Cookies
recipes.description: Soft spiced pumpkin cookies with cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Mix sugar, pumpkin, and shortening.
Combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and cinnamon.
Add to mixture and mix well.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake until light brown (8 to 10 minutes).
Glaze with cream cheese frosting.

recipes.title: Reese's Peanut Butter Cup Cookies
recipes.description: Peanut butter cookies with miniature peanut butter cups.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, cream peanut butter, oleo, 1/3 cup sugar, and brown sugar.
Add egg, milk, and vanilla; beating well.
Combine flour and baking soda and gradually add to creamed mixture, blending thoroughly.
Shape dough into 1 1/2 inch balls; roll in sugar.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10 to 12 minutes.
Remove from oven. Immediately place unwrapped peanut butter cup miniature in center of each cookie, pressing down.

recipes.title: Ginger Crinkles
recipes.description: Classic crinkled ginger cookies rolled in sugar.

instructions.text: Combine oil and sugar. Add egg and stir in molasses.
Sift flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and ginger.
Add to first mixture.
Roll in balls and then roll in confectioners sugar.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 6 minutes.

recipes.title: Grandma's Butter Cookies
recipes.description: Rich butter cookies with hard-boiled egg yolks.

instructions.text: Cream sugar and butter together.
Add grated egg yolks. Stir in milk and almond extract.
Combine flour and salt and add to other ingredients.
Roll out or drop by teaspoonfuls.
Decorate with nuts, cherries, or jam dollop in center.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10 to 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Marvelous Macaroons
recipes.description: Coconut almond macaroons.

instructions.text: Combine coconut, sugar, flour, and salt in mixing bowl.
Stir in egg whites and almond extract.
Stir in almonds. Mix well.
Drop from teaspoon onto lightly greased baking sheets.
Garnish with candied cherry halves if desired.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until edges of cookies are golden brown.
Remove from baking sheet immediately. Makes about 2 1/2 dozen.

recipes.title: Oatmeal Carmelitas
recipes.description: Oatmeal cookie bars with caramel and chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease 9x13 inch pan.
Mix crust ingredients at low speed until crumbly.
Press half, about 3 cups, of mixture in bottom of pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle warm crust with chocolate chips and nuts.
In small bowl, combine caramel topping and flour.
Drizzle over top and sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture.
Bake 18 to 22 minutes. Refrigerate 1 to 2 hours.

notes: Recipe continues from previous page

recipes.title: Chocolate Snow Top Cookies
recipes.description: Rich chocolate cookies rolled in powdered sugar.

instructions.text: Combine and set aside flour, baking powder, and salt.
Melt chocolate chips and butter.
Beat together sugar, vanilla, and eggs.
Add egg mixture to chocolate mixture; beat well. Add flour mixture; mix well.
Freeze dough until firm. Shape into 1 inch balls.
Roll in sifted confectioners sugar.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake 10 minutes (until top cracks).
Cool and remove.

recipes.title: Come and Get-Um Cookies
recipes.description: Peanut butter cookies with chocolate chips and peanuts.

instructions.text: Sift flour, soda, and salt.
Blend sugars, shortening, peanut butter, eggs, and vanilla and beat well.
Mix in chocolate and peanuts.
Form in balls and place on greased cookie sheet.
Press down with a floured fork.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 12 to 15 minutes.

recipes.title: End of the Month Cookies
recipes.description: Versatile cookie recipe using whatever ingredients you have on hand.

instructions.text: Cream together fat, sugar, eggs, and flavoring.
Sift together salt, soda, baking powder, and flour.
Add to creamed mixture. Add liquid and mix together. Chill well.
Roll out and cut as desired; roll in small balls.
Pat them in a flat pan to make bar cookies; or bake on greased pan at 375°F (190°C) for 8 minutes.
Watch carefully.

notes: A missionary 'hand-me down' recipe
Variations: Put in raisins, chocolate chips, coconut, nuts, orange peel, or leave them plain. Roll them in cinnamon sugar or frost with confectioners frosting.

recipes.title: Decorator Frosting
recipes.description: Smooth frosting for decorating cookies and cakes.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients. Beat well (up to 10 minutes) until smooth and creamy.
Use with frosting bags and tips to decorate cookies and cakes.

recipes.title: Brown-Eyed Susans
recipes.description: Butter cookies topped with chocolate mint candy.

instructions.text: Cream butter, sugar, egg, salt, and vanilla.
Stir in 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour.
Chill 1 hour. Shape into 1 inch diameter balls.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Top each with chocolate mint candy wafer (not cream filled).
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Chocolate Covered Cherry Cookies
recipes.description: Chocolate cookies with a maraschino cherry center and chocolate topping.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, stir together flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, and baking soda.
In a mixer bowl, beat together butter and sugar on low speed until fluffy.
Add egg and vanilla; beat well.
Gradually add dry ingredients; beat until well blended.
Shape into 1 inch balls; place on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Press down the center of the dough with your thumb.
Drain cherries, reserving the juice. Place a cherry in each cookie center.
In a small saucepan, combine chocolate pieces, condensed milk, and heat until chocolate melts.
Stir in 4 teaspoons of reserved cherry juice.
Spoon about 1 teaspoon of frosting on each cookie.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Filling for Danish
recipes.description: Sweet cream cheese filling for Danish pastries.

instructions.text: Mix cream cheese, egg yolk, 1/4 cup sugar, and flour until smooth.
Use as filling for Danish pastries.
Top with egg white wash, almonds, and remaining sugar before baking.

recipes.title: Sour Cream Coffee Cake
recipes.description: Rich coffee cake with brown sugar swirl.

instructions.text: Butter a 10 inch tube pan. Sift flour once; measure. Add baking powder and soda; sift again.
Set aside. Cream butter well with 1 cup sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
Blend in vanilla and lemon juice.
Add flour mix alternating with sour cream, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.
Mix brown sugar and cinnamon.
Pour half of batter into pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 brown sugar mix.
Cover with remaining butter and top with remaining brown sugar mix.
Bake in 350°F (175°C) oven for 45 to 50 minutes. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan.

recipes.title: Festive Fruitcake
recipes.description: Easy fruitcake made with quick bread mix.

ingredients.item: Pillsbury nut or date quick bread mix

instructions.text: Grease and flour bottom and sides of a 12 cup Bundt pan or 2 loaf pans.
Combine eggs, water, and oil in large bowl.
Add remaining ingredients, except corn syrup.
Stir by hand until combined and pour into greased pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 65 to 85 minutes, until toothpick comes out clean.
Cool 30 minutes and remove from pan.
If desired, glaze with warm corn syrup before serving.

recipes.title: Christmas Jello
recipes.description: Layered red and green Jello dessert with cream cheese.

instructions.text: Dissolve lime Jello with 1 cup hot water, then 2 cups cold water.
Add drained pineapple. Pour into 9x13 inch pan and refrigerate.
When firm, mix sugar and cream and heat until sugar dissolves.
Soften unflavored gelatin in 1/2 cup cold water.
Mix into sugar and cream mixture. Add nuts and pour into pan.
When this is firm, dissolve strawberry Jello in 1 cup hot water.
Add frozen strawberries. Pour over white layer and refrigerate.

recipes.title: Cranberry Apple Crisp
recipes.description: Warm apple crisp with cranberry sauce and granola topping.

instructions.text: Combine apples and cranberries in 10x6 inch baking dish.
Combine granola, coconut, and margarine. Sprinkle over apples.
Bake, covered, at 400°F (200°C) for 15 minutes.
Uncover and cook 10 to 15 minutes, till crisp and brown.

recipes.title: Layered Strawberry Cracker Dessert
recipes.description: Light no-bake strawberry dessert with graham crackers.

instructions.text: Prepare Jello according to package directions. Chill until slightly thickened (consistency of unbeaten egg whites, 1 1/2 hours in refrigerator).
Slice strawberries, reserving a few whole berries for garnish if desired.
Sprinkle sliced berries with sugar.
Fold whipped topping into Jello mixture, folding well. Add berries.
Place 9 graham cracker squares in bottom of 9 inch square pan.
Spread half of Jello mixture over crackers.
Repeat layer. Chill until firm, about 3 hours.
Cut into squares; top with additional Cool Whip.

recipes.title: Salted Nut Roll Bars
recipes.description: Layered bars with marshmallows, peanut butter, and salted peanuts.

instructions.text: Mix together flour, 1/2 cup oleo, baking soda, egg yolks, brown sugar, baking powder, and 1 tsp vanilla and pat into a 9x13 inch pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 12 minutes.
Sprinkle with 3 cups of mini-marshmallows and bake for 2 to 3 minutes.
Melt together: corn syrup, 2 tsp vanilla, 1/4 cup oleo, and peanut butter chips.
Add Rice Krispies and salted peanuts.
Spread on marshmallow base. Cool and cut into bars.

recipes.title: Cake Brownies
recipes.description: Light and cakey chocolate brownies.

instructions.text: Melt chocolate and butter. Mix flour with baking powder.
Beat eggs well. Gradually beat in sugar.
Blend in chocolate and vanilla. Mix in flour. Add nuts.
Bake in 350°F (175°C) oven for 25 minutes.

recipes.title: Cherry Cobbler
recipes.description: Easy cherry cobbler with self-rising batter.

instructions.text: Combine first 5 ingredients.
Melt shortening in an 8x8x2 inch pan.
Pour batter into melted shortening (do not stir).
Top with cherries and bake at 325°F (165°C) until golden brown.
(Cherries will be at the bottom.)

recipes.title: Nut Goodie Bars
recipes.description: Layered chocolate and peanut butter bars with maple filling.

ingredients.prep_note: regular dry, do not use instant

instructions.text: Mix and melt the chips and peanut butter. Put half into a buttered 12x16 inch pan and freeze.
Mix oleo, milk, and pudding together. Boil 1 minute. Add maple flavoring and powdered sugar.
Spread on top of frozen mixture and put back in freezer.
Add peanuts to remaining chocolate mixture and spread over filling.
Keep refrigerated. Cut into small squares.

notes: Keep refrigerated

recipes.title: Oatmeal Peanut Butter Bars
recipes.description: Chewy oat bars with peanut butter frosting.

instructions.text: Mix butter, sugars, eggs, vanilla, and peanut butter until smooth.
Sift together flour, soda, and salt. Add to peanut butter mix.
Add oats and stir until moist.
Spread in greased 9x13 inch pan. Pat until smooth.
Bake at 375°F for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool.
For frosting, mix powdered sugar, margarine, and peanut butter. Add enough milk for spreading consistency.
Cut into bars.

recipes.title: Date Dessert
recipes.description: Layered date and cookie dessert with whipped topping.

instructions.text: Crush cookies. Put all but 1/4 cup crumbs into square dish, 8 to 10 inches.
Bring to boil dates, water, and salt. Reduce heat and simmer 3 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and marshmallows. Cool a little and stir in nuts.
Spread on top of crumbs. Top with whipped topping. Sprinkle with reserved crumbs.
Refrigerate.

notes: Reserve 1/4 cup cookie crumbs for topping

recipes.title: Thousand Dollar Bars
recipes.description: Layered graham cracker bars with chocolate chips, coconut and walnuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Melt butter in 9x12 inch baking pan.
Sprinkle graham cracker crumbs over butter to cover it evenly, then do the same with the rest of the ingredients.
Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly, walnuts, next, and then coconut in layers.
Pour sweetened condensed milk over all and bake at 350°F for approximately 30 minutes, or until light brown around edge.
Cool and refrigerate. Cut into bars.

notes: For variation, I have used raisins and peanut butter chips.

recipes.title: Date Nut Bar
recipes.description: Simple date and walnut bars.

instructions.text: Mix all dry ingredients together and sprinkle over date and nut mixture.
Add melted butter.
Bake in buttered pan 30 minutes at 350°F.
Cut into 3/4 x 2 inch bars (sprinkle with confectioners sugar while still hot if desired).

notes: Can sprinkle with confectioners sugar while still hot

recipes.title: Nut Chocolate Bars
recipes.description: Chocolate bars with walnuts.

instructions.text: Recipe continues on next page - instructions not fully visible.

notes: Partial recipe - instructions cut off

flags: partial recipe visible

recipes.title: Snowballs
recipes.description: Buttery walnut cookies rolled in powdered sugar.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Add unbeaten egg and vanilla; beat well.
Sift together dry ingredients. Blend into creamed mixture. Add walnuts and chill for 30 minutes.
Roll dough into balls the size of large marbles. Bake 8 to 10 minutes.
Roll at once in confectioners sugar. Cool and roll again in sugar.

notes: Chill dough 30 minutes before rolling

recipes.title: Thumbprint Cookies
recipes.description: Pecan-coated cookies with jam centers.

instructions.text: Mix shortening, oleo, egg yolk, and vanilla. Add flour and salt. Roll in balls about the size of walnuts.
Dip balls in beaten egg white. Roll in chopped pecans.
Bake at 350°F for 5 minutes. Remove from oven; make a thumbprint in center of each cookie. Finish baking.
Frost, if desired, with jam or a mix of confectioners sugar, water, and food color.

recipes.title: Black Bottoms
recipes.description: Chocolate cupcakes with cream cheese and chocolate chip topping.

instructions.text: Mix in a bowl: cream cheese, eggs, 2/3 cup sugar, 1/4 tsp salt, and chocolate chips. Set aside.
Sift together: flour, cocoa, baking soda, 1 cup sugar, and 1/2 tsp salt.
Add to dry ingredients: water, oil, vinegar, and vanilla.
Pour flour/cocoa batter into muffin pan (lined or greased) to 1/3 full. Top each with cheese mixture.
Garnish with chopped almonds. Bake at 350°F for 30 to 35 minutes.

notes: Garnish with chopped almonds before baking

recipes.title: Orange Julius Supreme
recipes.description: Refreshing orange smoothie drink.

instructions.text: Blend ingredients together until like an icee.
Add an orange slice to the glass for garnishment. Serve chilled.

recipes.title: Russian Tea
recipes.description: Spiced tea mix with Tang and lemonade.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together and store in covered container.
Use desired amount of tea in hot water to suit taste (1 to 3 teaspoons per cup).

notes: Store in covered container

recipes.title: Strawberry Tea Punch
recipes.description: Refreshing tea punch with strawberries and lemonade.

instructions.text: In pitcher, pour water over tea bags. Brew 4 minutes. Remove tea bags.
Stir in sugar, lemonade, and strawberries. Serve over ice.

recipes.title: Buttermilk Chicken Dinner (Microwave)
recipes.description: Complete chicken dinner cooked in the microwave with vegetables.

ingredients.item: tiny new potatoes or medium red potatoes
ingredients.prep_note: peeled and quartered (I use more for my family)
1/2 tbsp vinegar and enough milk to make 1/2 cup

instructions.text: In 3 quart casserole, combine water, bouillon, thyme, rosemary, and bay leaves.
Rinse chicken. Pat dry. Place chicken, breast down in casserole. Cook, covered, on HIGH 10 minutes.
Turn chicken over. If using new potatoes, peel a strip around center. Arrange potatoes, onions, and carrot around chicken.
Cook, covered, on 50% (MEDIUM) 30 to 40 minutes or till drumsticks move easily and vegetables are tender, giving dish 1/2 turn and rearranging vegetables once.
Transfer to serving platter (recipe continues on next page).

notes: Recipe continues on next page

flags: partial recipe - continues on next page

recipes.title: Naturally Sweet Apple Crisp
recipes.description: Healthy apple crisp with whole wheat flour and oats, no added sugar.

instructions.text: Place apples in 8x8x2 inch pan. Mix lemon, apple juice, and pour over apples.
Mix flour, oats, spices, and add margarine and mix until crumbly.
Sprinkle evenly over apples.
Bake 45 minutes at 350°F.

notes: No added sugar - naturally sweetened with apple juice

recipes.title: Raisin Pudding
recipes.description: Baked raisin pudding with brown sugar sauce.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Blend in 2 tablespoons shortening. Add 1 cup of raisins and 1/2 cup milk.
Pour into casserole. Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.
Cover with sauce made from: 1 3/4 cups boiling water, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 tbsp butter.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Rice Pudding
recipes.description: Creamy stovetop rice pudding with cinnamon.

instructions.text: In a heavy pot, cover rice with water and boil until water is absorbed.
Add milk and sugar and boil, stirring constantly.
Beat eggs and slowly add to mixture.
Place mixture in dish and sprinkle cinnamon on top.
Cover with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator.

notes: Serve chilled

recipes.title: Strawberry Pretzel Jello
recipes.description: Three-layer dessert with pretzel crust, cream cheese, and strawberry jello.

ingredients.prep_note: juice and all (if 20 oz, remove 1/2 cup)

instructions.text: Part 1: Mix together pretzels, melted butter, and 3 tbsp sugar. Press into 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 400°F for 7 minutes. Cool.
Part 2: Blend cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar, and Cool Whip together and spread over cooled crust. Refrigerate.
Part 3: Dissolve jello in boiling water. Add pineapple and frozen strawberries.
Mix together and pour over cream cheese layer. Refrigerate approximately 4 hours.

notes: A classic layered dessert - pretzel crust must be completely cooled before adding cream cheese layer

recipes.title: Pecan Stuffed French Toast
recipes.attribution: Ann Dodge, The Grand Victoria Inn, Thomasville, GA, by C. Kehoe
recipes.description: Elegant stuffed French toast with cream cheese and pecans.

instructions.text: Blend cream cheese, vanilla, nuts, and 1 tablespoon sugar. Slice bread almost through every other slice to form pocket.
Spread with 1 tablespoon cream cheese mixture in each pocket.
Mix eggs, water, and other tablespoon of sugar. Dip bread and let it soak in mixture for a few minutes.
Fry on griddle or in pan with butter flavored shortening.
Sprinkle with cinnamon or nutmeg. Serve with maple syrup or fruit sauce.

notes: From The Grand Victoria Inn in Thomasville, Georgia

recipes.title: Pretzels
recipes.description: Homemade soft pretzels.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in water.
Add sugar and flour to yeast mixture. Knead and cut into 4 pieces.
Roll into 12 inch worms and place on greased cookie sheet. Shape into pretzels.
Brush with beaten egg, and sprinkle with salt.
Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Sausage-Apple Pocket
recipes.description: Turkey sausage and apple in a pita pocket with pancake syrup.

ingredients.item: fresh mild turkey breakfast sausage links
small red or Golden Delicious apple
ingredients.prep_note: about 1/4 lb, cored, pared, and thinly sliced

instructions.text: Spray skillet with nonstick cooking spray; add sausages and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add apples and stir to combine; cover and cook until apples are tender and soft, about 3 minutes.
Stir in syrup and cook, stirring constantly, until thoroughly heated, about 1 minute.
Open pita to form pocket. Fill pocket with apple sausage mixture.

notes: A lighter breakfast option with turkey sausage

recipes.title: Stroganoff Sandwich
recipes.description: Creamy beef stroganoff served on French bread or hoagies.

instructions.text: Cook beef with onion; drain. Stir in cream, milk, and Worcestershire sauce.
Add mustard, salt, and Worcestershire. Pour over bread and cheese.
Refrigerate 24 hours. Bake 1 hour at 300°F.

notes: Must refrigerate 24 hours before baking

flags: recipe spans two pages, some text partially visible

recipes.title: Corn Fritters
recipes.description: Quick and easy fried corn fritters.

ingredients.prep_note: cut off cob or use frozen

instructions.text: Cut corn off cob - or use frozen corn. Add all other ingredients. Mix well.
Drop by tablespoon onto greased, hot griddle or frying pan.
Fry till browned on both sides.

notes: Can use fresh corn off the cob or frozen corn

recipes.title: Keftedes
recipes.description: Greek-style fried meatballs with tomatoes and lemon.

instructions.text: Knead the mixture until smooth. Prepare 3 hours before frying so the mixture absorbs the flavoring.
Pour 2 cups of flour into a flat pan. Drop a spoonful of the mixture into the pan and roll into a ball.
Place in hot oil; flatten the balls and fry until golden brown.

notes: Let mixture rest 3 hours before frying for best flavor

recipes.title: Mexican Nopales
recipes.description: Traditional Mexican cactus paddle dish.

instructions.text: Pick tender new leaves before 11 A.M. Remove spines with a knife, being careful not to take off the skin.
Cut leaves into small cubes. Cube onion, garlic, and tomatoes.
Saute all 4 in olive oil. Add chicken broth. Simmer until tender.

notes: Pick cactus leaves early in the morning for best tenderness

recipes.title: Pancakes for Four
recipes.description: Classic buttermilk pancakes recipe sized for four people.

instructions.text: Sift flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and soda into a medium size bowl.
Add buttermilk and eggs. Beat until smooth.
Bake on a hot griddle to desired brownness.
Must use oil or baking spray to prevent sticking.

notes: Use oil or baking spray on griddle to prevent sticking

recipes.title: Deviled Eggs - The Best
recipes.description: Classic deviled eggs with bacon and sweet pickles.

instructions.text: Cut eggs lengthwise and remove yolks. Mash yolks with a fork and add remaining ingredients.
Blend well. Refill whites using approximately 2 teaspoons of egg mixture per half.
Hint: Fix the day before to let the seasonings blend.

notes: Make the day before for best flavor

recipes.title: Greg's Eggs
recipes.description: Spicy deviled eggs with jalapeno and bacon bits.

instructions.text: Hard-boil eggs and cut lengthwise; remove yolks.
Mix yolks with salad dressing, vinegar, sugar, and mustard until creamy.
Stir in shredded pickles and jalapeno pepper.
Add bacon bits and grated cheese; don't overstir. Stuff into egg white halves.

notes: Use real bacon bits - imitation ones get soggy
Adjust jalapeno to taste

recipes.title: Breakfast Pizza
recipes.description: Hearty breakfast pizza with sausage, eggs, and hash browns.

instructions.text: Brown ground pork; drain.
Form crust with rolls on an ungreased 12 inch pizza pan. Spoon pork over crust.
Sprinkle with potatoes and mushrooms. Top with cheeses.
Beat eggs and milk. Pour into crust. Sprinkle on Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 375°F for 25 to 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Cheese Strata
recipes.description: Make-ahead breakfast casserole with bread and cheese.

instructions.text: Cut crusts from bread; butter both sides. Break up bread. Put in baking dish (9x12 inches), then add 1/2 the cheese.
Reheat. To eggs, add milk, brown sugar, dry mustard, salt and Worcestershire.
Recipe continues on next page.

notes: Make ahead - refrigerate overnight before baking

flags: partial recipe - continues on next page

recipes.title: Spinach Nuggets (Microwave)
recipes.description: Quick spinach appetizer balls cooked in the microwave.

instructions.text: Place spinach and onion in 1 1/2 quart casserole with water. Cook, covered, on HIGH 9 to 11 minutes, stirring once. Let stand 3 minutes. Drain well.
Add butter and stir till melted. Add stuffing mix and Parmesan cheese. Stir in eggs.
Shape into 1 inch balls. May be frozen. (Put in freezer for 10 minutes after putting on waxed paper lined baking sheet; thaw before cooking.)
To cook now, place 1/2 of balls in a 12 x 7 1/2 x 2 inch baking dish. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes, or until heated through. Repeat with remaining 1/2 of balls.

notes: May be frozen ahead and thawed before cooking

recipes.title: Stuffed Fish Rolls with Spinach (Microwave)
recipes.description: Light fish rolls stuffed with breadcrumb mixture, served on spinach.

ingredients.item: tartar sauce or Miracle Whip and pickle relish

instructions.text: In 1 quart microwaveable casserole. Combine spinach and 1/2 onion and pepper; drizzle 1 tablespoon water over vegetables. Cover and microwave on HIGH (100%) for 4 minutes, stirring once and rotating 1/2 turn halfway through cooking. Into 2 individual microwaveable casseroles, spoon 1/2 of the spinach mixture; set aside.
In same 1 quart casserole, combine the remaining onion, pepper, and garlic. Microwave on HIGH 1 minute, until onion is softened. Add bread crumbs, tartar sauce, and lemon juice and stir to combine.

Onto center of each fillet, spoon 1/2 of the bread crumb mixture. Roll each fillet jelly roll fashion; secure with toothpick. Set fillets in same 1 quart casserole; cover and microwave on HIGH for 4 minutes, rotating casserole 1/2 turn halfway through cooking.

Set each fillet over spinach mixture in each individual casserole; sprinkle each with 1/2 of the Parmesan cheese and paprika. Cover and microwave on HIGH for 30 seconds, until spinach is heated through.

notes: Only 207 calories per serving

recipes.title: Favorite Meatloaf (Microwave)
recipes.description: Quick microwave meatloaf with tomato sauce glaze.

instructions.text: Combine tomato sauce, brown sugar, and mustard; set aside.
Combine remaining ingredients. Add 1/2 cup tomato sauce mixture; blend well.
Fill 8 cup microwave ring mold. Pour the remaining tomato sauce mixture over top.
Place in microwave oven. (Use temperature probe.) Cook on HIGH 12 minutes, turning 1/4 turn every 3 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes.
Temperature probe should read 160°F when cooking is completed.

notes: Use temperature probe if available

recipes.title: Easy Cheesy Scrambled Eggs (Microwave)
recipes.description: Fluffy microwave scrambled eggs with bacon and cheese.

instructions.text: Place bacon on microwave safe rack or paper plate. Cover with paper towel. Microwave 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 minutes, or till done. Drain, crumble, and set aside.
In 1 quart casserole, combine green pepper, onion, and water. Cover and cook on HIGH 1 to 2 minutes, or until tender.
Stir in beaten eggs and cheese. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 3 1/2 to 6 minutes, or till eggs are almost set, pushing cooked portions to the center several times during cooking.
Let stand till eggs are set. Sprinkle with crumbled bacon.

notes: Push cooked portions to center during cooking for fluffy eggs

recipes.title: Microwave Stuffed Peppers
recipes.description: Classic stuffed peppers made quickly in the microwave.

instructions.text: Cut off tops of green peppers; remove seeds and membrane. Mix raw beef with onion, rice, salt, pepper, and garlic. Divide evenly into peppers.
Arrange peppers upright snugly in 3 quart casserole, so one pepper fits into center of dish.
Recipe continues on next page.

notes: Recipe continues on next page

flags: partial recipe - continues on next page

recipes.title: Three Minute Fudge
recipes.description: Quick and easy stovetop fudge, ready in just 3 minutes of cooking.

instructions.text: Mix oleo, milk, sugar, cocoa, and salt in a saucepan. Bring to a rolling boil.
Boil for 3 minutes. Take off burner; add vanilla. Let cool.
Use on Crazy Cake just as fudge is starting to set. Or put peanuts in to make turtles.
Place on wax paper until cool. Enjoy - yum yum!

notes: Can be used as frosting on Crazy Cake or made into turtle candies with peanuts

recipes.title: Allspice
recipes.content: A pea-sized fruit that grows in Mexico, Jamaica, Central and South America. Its delicate flavor resembles a blend of cloves, cinnamon and nutmeg. USES: (Whole) Pickles, meats, boiled fish, gravies. (Ground) Puddings, relishes, fruit preserves, baking.

recipes.title: Basil
recipes.content: The dried leaves and stems of an herb grown in the United States and North Mediterranean area. Has an aromatic, leafy flavor. USES: For flavoring tomato dishes and tomato paste, turtle soup; also use in cooked peas, squash, snap beans; sprinkle chopped over lamb chops and poultry.

recipes.title: Bay Leaves
recipes.content: The dried leaves of an evergreen grown in the eastern Mediterranean countries. Has a sweet, herbaceous floral spice note. USES: For pickling, stews, for spicing sauces and soup. Also use with a variety of meats and fish.

recipes.title: Caraway
recipes.content: The seed of a plant grown in the Netherlands. Flavor that combines the tastes of Anise and Dill. USES: For the cordial Kummel, baking breads; often added to sauerkraut, noodles, cheese spreads. Also adds zest to French fried potatoes, liver; canned asparagus.

recipes.title: Curry Powder
recipes.content: A ground blend of ginger, turmeric, fenugreek seed, as many as 16 to 20 spices. USES: For all Indian curry recipes such as lamb, chicken, and rice, eggs, vegetables, and curry puffs.

recipes.title: Dill
recipes.content: The small, dark seed of the dill plant grown in India, having a clean, aromatic taste. USES: Dill is a predominant seasoning in pickling recipes; also adds pleasing flavor to sauerkraut, potato salad, cooked macaroni, and green apple pie.

recipes.title: Mace
recipes.content: The dried covering around the nutmeg seed. Its flavor is similar to nutmeg, but with a fragrant, delicate difference. USES: (Whole) For pickling, fish, fish sauce, stewed fruit. (Ground) Delicious in baked goods, pastries and doughnuts, adds unusual flavor to chocolate desserts.

recipes.title: Marjoram
recipes.content: An herb of the mint family, grown in France and Chile. Has a minty-sweet flavor. USES: In beverages, jellies and to flavor soups, stews, fish, sauces. Also excellent to sprinkle on lamb while roasting.

recipes.title: MSG (Monosodium Glutamate)
recipes.content: A vegetable protein derivative for raising the effectiveness of natural food flavors. USES: Small amounts, adjusted to individual taste, can be added to steaks, roasts, chops, seafoods, stews, soups, chowder, chop suey and cooked vegetables.

recipes.title: Oregano
recipes.content: A plant of the mint family and a species of marjoram of which the dried leaves are used to make an herb seasoning. USES: An excellent flavoring for any tomato dish, especially pizza, chili con carne, and Italian specialties.

recipes.title: Paprika
recipes.content: A mild, sweet red pepper growing in Spain, Central Europe and the United States. Slightly aromatic and prized for brilliant red color. USES: A colorful garnish for pale foods, and for seasoning Chicken Paprika, Hungarian Goulash, salad dressings.

recipes.title: Poppy Seeds
recipes.content: The seed of a flower grown in Holland. Has a rich fragrance and crunchy, nut-like flavor. USES: Excellent as a topping for breads, rolls and cookies. Also delicious in buttered noodles.

recipes.title: Rosemary
recipes.content: An herb (like a curved pine needle) grown in France, Spain, and Portugal, and having a sweet, fresh taste. USES: In lamb dishes, in soups, stews and to sprinkle on beef before roasting.

recipes.title: Sage
recipes.content: The leaf of a shrub grown in Greece, Yugoslavia and Albania. Flavor is camphora-ceous and minty. USES: For meat and poultry stuffing, sausages, meat loaf, hamburgers, stews and salads.

recipes.title: Thyme
recipes.content: The leaves and stems of a shrub grown in France and Spain. Has a strong, distinctive flavor. USES: For poultry seasoning, in croquettes, fricassees and fish dishes. Also tasty on fresh sliced tomatoes.

recipes.title: Turmeric
recipes.content: A root of the ginger family, grown in India, Haiti, Jamaica and Peru, having a mild, ginger-pepper flavor. USES: As a flavoring and coloring in prepared mustard and in combination with mustard as a flavoring for meats, dressings, salads.

recipes.title: Measurement Equivalents Chart
recipes.content: Common measurement equivalents: 3 tsp = 1 Tbsp | 2 Tbsp = 1/8 cup | 4 Tbsp = 1/4 cup | 8 Tbsp = 1/2 cup | 16 Tbsp = 1 cup | 5 Tbsp + 1 tsp = 1/3 cup | 12 Tbsp = 3/4 cup | 4 oz = 1/2 cup | 8 oz = 1 cup | 16 oz = 1 lb | 1 oz = 2 Tbsp fat or liquid | 2 cups = 1 pt | 2 pt = 1 qt | 4 qt = 1 gal | 1 jigger = 1-1/2 fl oz (3 Tbsp) | 8 to 10 egg whites = 1 cup | 12 to 14 egg yolks = 1 cup | 1 cup unwhipped cream = 2 cups whipped | 1 lb shredded American cheese = 4 cups.

recipes.title: Ingredient Substitutions
recipes.content: Substitutions for missing ingredients: 1 square chocolate (1 oz) = 3-4 Tbsp cocoa + 1/2 Tbsp fat | 1 Tbsp cornstarch (for thickening) = 2 Tbsp flour | 1 cup sifted all-purpose flour = 1 cup + 2 Tbsp sifted cake flour | 1 cup sifted cake flour = 1 cup - 2 Tbsp sifted all-purpose flour | 1 tsp baking powder = 1/4 tsp baking soda + 1/2 tsp cream of tartar | 1 cup sour milk = 1 cup sweet milk + 1 Tbsp vinegar or lemon juice (stirred) | 1 cup sweet milk = 1 cup sour milk or buttermilk + 1/2 tsp baking soda | 3/4 cup cracker crumbs = 1 cup bread crumbs | 1 cup cream, sour, heavy = 1/3 cup butter + 2/3 cup milk | 1 tsp dried herbs = 1 Tbsp fresh herbs | 1 cup whole milk = 1/2 cup evaporated milk + 1/2 cup water OR 1 cup reconstituted nonfat dry milk + 1 Tbsp butter | 2 oz compressed yeast = 3 (1/4 oz) packets dry yeast | 1 Tbsp instant minced onion = 1 small fresh onion | 1 Tbsp prepared mustard = 1 tsp dry mustard | 1/8 tsp garlic powder = 1 small pressed clove garlic | 1 lb whole dates = 1-1/2 cups pitted and cut | 3 medium bananas = 1 cup mashed | 3 cups dry corn flakes = 1 cup crushed | 10 miniature marshmallows = 1 large marshmallow.

recipes.title: General Oven Temperature Chart
recipes.content: Oven temperature guide: Very slow oven = 250° to 300°F | Slow oven = 300° to 325°F | Moderate oven = 325° to 375°F | Medium hot oven = 375° to 400°F | Hot oven = 400° to 450°F | Very hot oven = 450° to 500°F.

recipes.title: Contents of Cans - Standard Sizes
recipes.content: Standard can sizes and contents: 8 oz = 1 cup | Picnic = 1-1/4 cups | No. 300 = 1-3/4 cups | No. 1 tall = 2 cups | No. 303 = 2 cups | No. 2 = 2-1/2 cups | No. 2-1/2 = 3-1/2 cups | No. 3 = 4 cups | No. 10 = 12 to 13 cups.

recipes.title: Food Quantities for 25, 50, and 100 Servings
recipes.content: Guide for cooking for crowds - selected items for 25/50/100 servings: BREAD: Rolls 4 doz/8 doz/16 doz, Bread 50 slices or 3 1-lb loaves/100 slices or 6 loaves/200 slices or 12 loaves | MEAT: Weiners (beef) 6-1/2 lb/13 lb/25 lb, Hamburger 9 lb/18 lb/35 lb, Turkey or chicken 13 lb/25-35 lb/50-75 lb | SALADS: Potato Salad 4-1/4 qt/2-1/4 gal/4-1/2 gal | VEGETABLES: Mashed Potatoes 9 lb/18-20 lb/25-35 lb, Canned Vegetables 1 #10 can/2-1/2 #10 cans/4 #10 cans | DESSERTS: Cake 1 10x12" sheet/1 12x20" sheet/2 12x20" sheets | BEVERAGES: Coffee 1/2 lb + 1-1/2 gal water/1 lb + 3 gal water/2 lb + 6 gal water.

recipes.title: Easy Blender Cleaning
recipes.content: Fill blender part way with hot water; add a drop of detergent; cover and turn it on for a few seconds. Rinse and drain dry.

recipes.title: Can Opener Cleaning
recipes.content: Loosen grime from can openers by brushing with an old toothbrush. To clean blades, run a paper towel through the cutting process.

recipes.title: Fix a Scorched Saucepan
recipes.content: Don't panic if you accidentally scorch the inside of your favorite saucepan. Just fill the pan halfway with water and add 1/4 cup baking soda. Boil awhile until the burned portions loosen and float to the top.

recipes.title: Double-Boiler Water Warning
recipes.content: A jar lid or a couple of marbles in the bottom half of a double-boiler will rattle when the water gets low and warn you to add more before the pan scorches or burns.

recipes.title: Remove Lime from Teakettles
recipes.content: To remove lime deposits from teakettles, fill with equal parts vinegar and water. Bring to a boil and allow to stand overnight.

recipes.title: Washing Fine China and Crystal
recipes.content: Before washing fine china and crystal, place a towel in the bottom of the sink to act as a cushion.

recipes.title: Remove Coffee and Tea Stains
recipes.content: To remove coffee or tea stains and cigarette burns from fine china, rub with a damp cloth dipped in baking soda.

recipes.title: Remove Stuck Food from Casseroles
recipes.content: To quickly remove food that is stuck to a casserole dish, fill with boiling water and 2 tablespoons of baking soda or salt.

recipes.title: Clear a Clogged Drain
recipes.content: To clear a sink or basin drain, pour 1/2 cup of baking soda followed by a cup of vinegar down the drain. Let the mixture foam, then run hot water. When a drain is clogged with grease, pour a cup of salt and a cup of baking soda followed by a kettle of boiling water.

recipes.title: Polish Silver with Baking Soda
recipes.content: Silver will gleam after a rubbing with damp baking soda on a soft cloth.

recipes.title: Grater Cleaning Tips
recipes.content: For a fast and simple clean-up of your hand grater, rub salad oil on the grater before using. A toothbrush works great to clean lemon rind, cheese, onion, etc. out of the grater before washing it.

recipes.title: Handle Fruit Pie Juice Spills
recipes.content: While baking fruit pies, does the juice runneth over? Shake salt into the spills. They'll burn to a crisp and can be easily scraped up with a spatula.

recipes.title: Remove Grease Splatters
recipes.content: Grease splatters or other foods that have dried on the stove, burner rings, counter appliances, etc., may be removed by applying dry baking soda to the spots, then rubbing with a damp cloth. Rinse with clear water, dry and enjoy the like-new look.

recipes.title: Remove Corn Silk Easily
recipes.content: A dampened paper towel or terry cloth brushed downward on a cob of corn will remove every strand of corn silk.

recipes.title: Remove Corn Kernels from Cob
recipes.content: An easy way to remove the kernels of sweet corn from the cob is to use a shoe horn. It's built just right for shearing off those kernels in a jiffy.

recipes.title: Test Egg Freshness
recipes.content: To determine whether an egg is fresh, immerse it in a pan of cool, salted water. If it sinks, it is fresh; if it rises to the surface, throw it away. Fresh eggs' shells are rough and chalky; old eggs are smooth and shiny. To determine whether an egg is hard-boiled, spin it. If it spins, it is hard-boiled; if it wobbles and will not spin it is raw.

recipes.title: Egg White Tips
recipes.content: Egg whites won't run while boiling or poaching if you'll add a little vinegar to the water. Eggs will beat up fluffier if they are allowed to come to cool room temperature before beating. For baking, it's best to use medium to large eggs; extra large eggs may cause cakes to fall when cooled.

recipes.title: Peel Hard-Boiled Eggs Easily
recipes.content: Egg shells can be easily removed from hard-boiled eggs if they are quickly rinsed in cold water first.

recipes.title: Fluffier Omelets and Never-Weep Meringue
recipes.content: For fluffier omelets, add a pinch of cornstarch before beating. For a never fail, never weep meringue, add a teaspoon of cornstarch to the sugar before beating it into the egg whites. Once your meringue is baked, cut it cleanly using a knife coated with butter.

recipes.title: Cover Meringue Pie Without Sticking
recipes.content: A meringue pie may be covered with waxed paper or plastic wrap with no fear of sticking, if you'll first grease the paper with oleo.

recipes.title: Bacon Tips
recipes.content: No 'curly' bacon for breakfast when you dip it into cold water before frying. Keep bacon slices from sticking together; roll the package into a tube shape and secure with rubber bands. A quick way to separate frozen bacon: heat a spatula over a burner, slide it under each slice to separate it from the others.

recipes.title: Keep Cheese Fresh
recipes.content: Cheese won't harden if you'll butter the exposed edges before storing. A cloth dampened with vinegar and wrapped around cheese will also prevent drying out.

recipes.title: Meat Cooking Tips
recipes.content: Thaw fish in milk. The milk draws out the frozen taste and provides a fresh-caught flavor. When browning any piece of meat, the job will be done more quickly and effectively if the meat is very dry and the fat is very hot.

recipes.title: Get More Lemon Juice
recipes.content: You'll get more juice from a lemon if you'll first warm it slightly in the oven.

recipes.title: Perfect Popcorn Tips
recipes.content: Popcorn will stay fresh and you will eliminate 'old maids' if you store it in the freezer. Running ice cold water over the kernels before popping will also eliminate 'old maids'.

recipes.title: Better Fried Chicken
recipes.content: After flouring chicken, chill for one hour. The coating adheres better during frying.

recipes.title: Store Bread Crumbs
recipes.content: Empty salt cartons with spouts make dandy containers for bread crumbs. A funnel is used for getting the crumbs into the carton.

recipes.title: Fix Lumpy Sugar
recipes.content: A sack of lumpy sugar won't be if you place it in the refrigerator for 24 hours.

recipes.title: Soften Brown Sugar
recipes.content: A slice of soft bread placed in the package of hardened brown sugar will soften it again in a couple of hours.

recipes.title: Potato Cooking Tips
recipes.content: Potatoes will bake in a hurry if they are boiled in salted water for 10 minutes before popping into a very hot oven. A leftover baked potato can be rebaked if you dip it in water and bake in a 350° oven for about 20 minutes. A thin slice cut from each end of the potato will speed up baking time as well.

recipes.title: Cut Onions Without Tears
recipes.content: You'll shed less tears if you'll cut the root end off of the onion last. No more tears when peeling onions if you place them in the deep freeze for four or five minutes first.

recipes.title: Easy Fruit Peeling
recipes.content: Scalding tomatoes, peaches, or pears in boiling water before peeling makes it easier on you and the fruit — skins slip right off.

recipes.title: Ripen Fruit Faster
recipes.content: Ripen green fruits by placing in a perforated plastic bag. The holes allow air movement, yet retain the odorless gas which fruits produce to promote ripening. To hasten the ripening of garden tomatoes or avocados, put them in a brown paper bag, close the bag and leave at room temperature for a few days.

recipes.title: Pan Frying Tips
recipes.content: When pan frying always heat the pan before adding the butter or oil. A little salt sprinkled into the frying pan will prevent spattering. Meat loaf will not stick if you place a slice of bacon on the bottom of the pan.

recipes.title: Prevent Food from Sticking
recipes.content: Vinegar brought to a boil in a new frying pan will prevent foods from sticking. Muffins will slide right out of tin pans if the hot pan is first placed on a wet towel. No sticking to the pan when you're scalding milk if you'll first rinse the pan in cold water.

recipes.title: Reduce Broiling Smoke
recipes.content: Add a cup of water to the bottom portion of the broiling pan before sliding into the oven, to absorb smoke and grease.

recipes.title: Hide Cooking Odors
recipes.content: A few teaspoons of sugar and cinnamon slowly burned on top of the stove will hide unpleasant cooking odors and make your family think you've been baking all day!

recipes.title: Prevent Boiling Over
recipes.content: A lump of butter or a few teaspoons of cooking oil added to water when boiling rice, noodles, or spaghetti will prevent boiling over. Rubbing the inside of the cooking vessel with vegetable oil will also prevent noodles, spaghetti, and similar starches from boiling over.

recipes.title: Better Rice
recipes.content: A few drops of lemon juice added to simmering rice will keep the grains separate.

recipes.title: Butter and Shortening Tips
recipes.content: Grating a stick of butter softens it quickly. Soften butter for spreading by inverting a small heated pan over the butter dish for a while. A dip of the spoon or cup into hot water before measuring shortening or butter will cause the fat to slip out easily without sticking to the spoon.

recipes.title: Measure Sticky Ingredients
recipes.content: Before measuring honey or other syrup, oil the cup with cooking oil and rinse in hot water.

recipes.title: Empty Catsup Bottle Faster
recipes.content: Catsup will flow out of the bottle evenly if you will first insert a drinking straw, push it to the bottom of the bottle, and remove.

recipes.title: Unmold Gelatin Easily
recipes.content: If you wet the dish on which the gelatin is to be unmolded, it can be moved around until centered.

recipes.title: Fix Over-Salted Food
recipes.content: If you've over-salted soup or vegetables, add cut raw potatoes and discard once they have cooked and absorbed the salt. A teaspoon each of cider vinegar and sugar added to salty soup or vegetables will also remedy the situation. If you've over-sweetened a dish, add salt. A teaspoon of cider vinegar will take care of too-sweet vegetable or main dishes.

recipes.title: Perfect Gravy Tips
recipes.content: Pale gravy may be browned by adding a bit of instant coffee straight from the jar — no bitter taste, either. If you will brown the flour well before adding to the liquid when making gravy, you will avoid pale or lumpy gravy. A different way of browning flour is to put it in a custard cup placed beside meat in the oven. Thin gravy can be thickened by adding a mixture of flour or cornstarch and water, added gradually, stirring constantly, while bringing to a boil. Lumpless gravy can be your triumph if you add a pinch of salt to the flour before mixing it with water. A small amount of baking soda added to gravy will eliminate excess grease.

recipes.title: Remove Fat from Soups
recipes.content: Drop a lettuce leaf into a pot of homemade soup to absorb excess grease from the top. If time allows, the best method of removing fat is refrigeration until the fat hardens. If you put a piece of waxed paper over the top of the soup, it can be peeled right off, along with the hardened fat. Ice cubes will also eliminate the fat from soup and stew. Just drop a few into the pot and stir; the fat will cling to the cubes; discard the cubes before they melt. Or, wrap ice cubes in paper towel or cheesecloth and skim over the top.

recipes.title: Revive Wilted Vegetables
recipes.content: If fresh vegetables are wilted or blemished, pick off the brown edges, sprinkle with cool water, wrap in paper towel and refrigerate for an hour or so. Perk up soggy lettuce by adding lemon juice to a bowl of cold water and soak for an hour in the refrigerator. Lettuce and celery keep longer if you store them in paper bags instead of cellophane. To remove the core from a head of lettuce, hit the core end once against the counter sharply. The core will loosen and pull out easily.

recipes.title: Whipping Cream Tips
recipes.content: Cream will whip faster and better if you'll first chill the cream, bowl, and beaters well. Soupy whipped cream can be saved by adding an egg white, then chilling thoroughly. Re-beat for a fluffy surprise! A few drops of lemon juice added to whipping cream helps it whip faster and better. Cream whipped ahead of time will not separate if you add 1/4 teaspoon unflavored gelatin per cup of cream. A dampened and folded dish towel placed under the bowl in which you are whipping cream will keep the bowl from dancing all over the counter top.

recipes.title: Brown Sugar Storage
recipes.content: Brown sugar won't harden if an apple slice is placed in the container. But if your brown sugar is already brick-hard, put your cheese-grater to work and grate the amount you need.

recipes.title: Microwave Softening Tips
recipes.content: Soften hardened brown sugar: place open box in microwave with 1 cup hot water, microwave at high for 1½ to 2 minutes for ½ pound or 2 to 3 minutes for 1 pound. Soften hard ice cream by microwaving at 30% power (one pint 15-30 seconds, one quart 30-45 seconds, half-gallon 45 seconds to one minute). Soften one stick of butter or margarine in 1 minute at 20% power. Soften one 8-ounce package of cream cheese at 30% power for 2 to 2½ minutes (3-ounce package 1½ to 2 minutes).

recipes.title: Microwave Thawing Tips
recipes.content: Thaw frozen orange juice right in the container. Remove the top metal lid. Place the opened container in the microwave and heat on high power 30 seconds for 6 ounces and 45 seconds for 12 ounces. Thaw whipped topping (4½ ounce carton) in 1 minute on the defrost setting. Whipped topping should be slightly firm in the center but will blend well when stirred. Do not overthaw!

recipes.title: Microwave Reheating and Refreshing
recipes.content: Soften jello that has set too hard by heating on a low power setting for a very short time. Dissolve gelatin in the microwave: measure liquid in a measuring cup, add jello and heat. There will be less stirring to dissolve the gelatin. Heat hot packs in a microwave oven (a wet finger tip towel will take about 25 seconds, depending on temperature of water used). To scald milk, cook 1 cup milk for 2-2½ minutes, stirring once each minute. To make dry bread crumbs, cut 6 slices bread into ½-inch cubes, microwave in 3-quart casserole 6-7 minutes or until dry, stirring after 3 minutes. Crush in blender. Refresh stale potato chips, crackers or other snacks by putting a plateful in the microwave oven for about 30-45 seconds. Let stand for 1 minute to crisp. Cereals can also be crisped.

recipes.title: Microwave Cooking Tips
recipes.content: Melt almond bark for candy or dipping pretzels (one pound takes about 2 minutes, stirring twice). If it hardens while dipping candy, microwave for a few seconds longer. Nuts will be easier to shell if you place 2 cups of nuts in a 1-quart casserole with 1 cup of water. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes and the nut meats will slip out whole after cracking the shell. When thawing hamburger meat, the outside will many times begin cooking before the meat is completely thawed. Defrost for 3 minutes, then remove the outside portions that have de-frosted. Continue defrosting the hamburger, taking off the defrosted outside portions at short intervals. To drain the fat from hamburger while it is cooking in the microwave oven (one pound cooks in 5 minutes on high), cook it in a plastic colander placed inside a casserole dish. Cubed meat and chopped vegetables will cook more evenly if cut uniformly.

recipes.title: Microwave Baking Tips
recipes.content: When baking large cakes, brownies, or moist bars, place a juice glass in the center of the baking dish to prevent a soggy middle and ensure uniform baking throughout. Since cakes and quick breads rise higher in a microwave oven, fill pans just half full of batter. Using a round dish instead of a square one eliminates overcooked corners in baking cakes. When preparing chicken in a dish, place meaty pieces around the edges and the bony pieces in the center of the dish. Shaping meatloaf into a ring eliminates undercooked center (a glass set in the center of a dish can serve as the mold). A crusty coating of chopped walnuts surrounding many microwave-cooked cakes and quick breads enhances the looks and eating quality. Sprinkle a layer of medium finely chopped walnuts evenly onto the bottom and sides of a ring pan or Bundt cake pan. Pour in batter and microwave as recipe directs.

recipes.title: Microwave Food Safety Tips
recipes.content: Treat fresh meat cuts for 15 to 20 seconds on high in the microwave oven. This cuts down on meat-spoiling types of bacteria. Do not salt foods on the surface as it causes dehydration (meats and vegetables) and toughens the food. Salt the meat after you remove it from the oven unless the recipe calls for using salt in the mixture.

recipes.title: More Microwave Tips
recipes.content: For stamp collectors: place a few drops of water on stamp to be removed from envelope. Heat in the microwave for 20 seconds and the stamp will come right off. Heat left-over custard and use it as frosting for a cake. Melt marshmallow creme in the microwave oven. Half of a 7-ounce jar will melt in 35-40 seconds on high. Stir to blend. Toast coconut in the microwave. Watch closely as it browns quickly once it begins to brown. Spread ½ cup coconut in a pie plate and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds after 2 minutes. Place a cake dish up on another dish or on a roasting rack if you have difficulty getting the bottom of the cake done. This also works for potatoes and other foods that don't quite get done on the bottom.

recipes.title: Calorie Counter - Meats
recipes.content: Beef calories per serving: Ground beef (lean, 10% fat, broiled) 4 oz = 248 | Sirloin steak (lean only, broiled) 4 oz = 245 | T-bone steak (lean only, broiled) 4 oz = 253 | Chuck roast (lean only, pot-roasted) 4 oz = 219 | Beef corned (medium-fat) 4 oz = 422. Pork: Boston butt (lean only, roasted) 4 oz = 279 | Pork chop (lean only, broiled) 4 oz = 308 | Pork loin (lean only, roasted) 4 oz = 288. Lamb: Chop (lean only, broiled) 2-3 oz = 122 | Leg (lean and fat, roasted, boneless) 4 oz = 317 | Shoulder (lean only, roasted) 4 oz = 233.

recipes.title: Calorie Counter - Poultry
recipes.content: Chicken calories: Broiled (meat only) 4 oz = 154 | Roasted (dark meat, no skin) 4 oz = 207 | Roasted (light meat, no skin) 4 oz = 170 | Canned with beans 1/2 cup = 179 | Canned without beans 1/2 cup = 255. Turkey: Dark meat (roasted) 4 oz = 230 | Light meat (roasted) 4 oz = 200 | Canned (boned) 1/2 cup = 207. Duck (roasted, meat only) 4 oz = 352.

recipes.title: Calorie Counter - Seafood
recipes.content: Fish calories: Cod (broiled with butter) 4 oz = 192 | Fish sticks (breaded) 5 sticks = 276 | Flounder (baked) 4 oz = 226 | Haddock (fried, breaded) 4 oz = 187 | Halibut (broiled with butter) 4 oz = 254 | Salmon (smoked) 4 oz = 254 | Tuna (canned in oil, drained) 1/2 cup = 158 | Tuna (canned in water) 4 oz = 144.
