recipes.title: Seafood Specialty
recipes.source_note: MomMom's cookbook, page 46 - printed community cookbook
recipes.description: A rich baked casserole with shrimp, tuna, crabmeat, and mushrooms in a creamy base.

instructions.text: Cook soup and rice in water until tender.
Saute celery, onion, and pepper in margarine.
Combine all ingredients.
Top with sliced almonds, grated Cheddar, and paprika.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Seafood Stew
recipes.source_note: MomMom's cookbook, page 46 - printed community cookbook
recipes.description: A hearty stew with salt pork, potatoes, shrimp, and whitefish in a tomato base.

instructions.text: In a large saucepot, cook salt pork until crisp. Remove pork and reserve.
Add onion, green pepper, and celery and saute about 5 minutes.
Add reserved pork, potatoes, tomatoes, and seasonings.
Cover and simmer 45 minutes.
Add shrimp, fish, and scallops and simmer 10 minutes longer.

recipes.title: All Seasons Pesto Spaghetti
recipes.source_note: MomMom's cookbook, page 46 - printed community cookbook
recipes.description: A quick pesto pasta with dried basil that can be made year-round.

instructions.text: Mix water and basil; set aside for 30 minutes.
Heat margarine and garlic until margarine melts.
Remove from heat.
Whisk in basil mixture, lemon juice, parsley, and cheese.
Toss with hot, cooked spaghetti, and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Beef Manicotti
recipes.source_note: MomMom's cookbook, page 47 - printed community cookbook
recipes.description: Stuffed manicotti shells with ground beef, Mozzarella, and Italian seasonings baked in tomato sauce.

instructions.text: Cook ground beef and 1/4 cup onion in 10 inch skillet, stirring frequently; drain.
Stir in bread, 1 1/2 cups Mozzarella, egg, milk, parsley, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Fill uncooked manicotti shells, packing beef into both ends.
Place shells in ungreased 13x9x2 inch pan.
Heat remaining ingredients, except Parmesan cheese, to boiling in Dutch oven, stirring occasionally; reduce heat.
Simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes.
Pour sauce over shells.
Cover and bake in 375° oven 1 1/2 hours to 1 3/4 hours, or until shells are tender.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Impossible Lasagne Pie
recipes.source_note: MomMom's cookbook, page 47 - printed community cookbook
recipes.description: A crustless 'impossible' pie with lasagna flavors - ground beef, cottage cheese, and Italian herbs.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°.
Grease pie plate, 10 x 1 1/2 inches.
Layer cottage and Parmesan cheese in plate.
Mix beef, herbs, paste, and 1/2 cup Mozzarella.
Spoon on top.
Beat milk, baking mix, eggs, salt, and pepper 15 seconds in blender on high or 1 minute with hand blender.
Pour into plate.
Bake until knife inserted between center and edge comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes.
Sprinkle with remaining Mozzarella.

recipes.title: Italian Stir-Fry
recipes.source_note: MomMom's cookbook, page 47 - printed community cookbook
recipes.description: A quick pasta dish with fresh vegetables, herbs, and two cheeses.

instructions.text: Cook pasta. Set aside.
Prepare all vegetables.
In stir-fry pan or wok, heat oil.
Add crushed garlic.
Add zucchini and onion.
Stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add parsley, tomatoes, basil, pasta, Parmesan, and Mozzarella.
Toss gently.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Grilled Meat Burritos
recipes.description: Grilled meat tacos with pinto beans, served in large flour tortillas with a fresh salsa.

instructions.text: Prepare the marinade, then mix all the ingredients in a large bowl. Add the meat in a small dish. Set aside for one or two hours.
To prepare the salsa, add all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Put the meat in a pot and cook.
Heat grill to 450-550°F. Roast the meat for about 8-9 minutes. Remove when done, place on board and cut into smaller pieces.

Assemble the burritos by placing the tortilla on a flat surface. At the center of the tortilla, place 3/4 cup of beans, 1/2 cup of meat and 1/3 cup of salsa. Roll the burrito up, and fold the sides to seal in the fillings. Repeat with each burrito. Serve while warm.

notes: This recipe was captured from a digital source (page 32 of 40) and may be incomplete
The specific meat type is not specified in this page - likely beef or chicken based on context

flags.issue: Partial recipe - meat type and full marinade not specified

recipes.title: Pork Belly Burrito
recipes.description: The pork belly burrito is probably the best accident to have ever occurred. Very easy to prepare with easily available ingredients.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 275°F.

In a large bowl, combine all seven marinade ingredients (garlic, soy sauce, Sriracha, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, pepper, salt). Add the pork belly and season with additional salt and pepper. Cook in the oven for one hour.
After one hour, increase oven temperature to 300°F and cook for another hour. Stir the pork occasionally to ensure even roasting. The pork will be ready after the second hour.

notes: Pages 35-36 were not captured, but core recipe is complete

recipes.title: Kale & Brown Rice Burrito with Feta
recipes.description: A healthy vegetarian burrito with sautéed kale, brown rice, beans, and crumbled feta cheese.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan, heat the beans over low heat. Add salt and some water.
In another saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add the red onion and cook until browned, about 6-7 minutes.
Add the kale and stir while the mixture cooks. Cook until kale starts to wilt. Finish with a seasoning of cayenne.
On the tortilla, put a spoonful of rice, kale, onions and beans at the center. Top with feta and seal.

notes: Can use spinach tortillas as an alternative to flour

recipes.title: Easy Tuscan Pasta Salad
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe clipping featuring ATHENOS and GOOD SEASONS products
recipes.description: A quick and easy pasta salad with Mediterranean flavors - cherry tomatoes, feta cheese, and sun-dried tomato vinaigrette.

ingredients.item: sun dried tomato vinaigrette with roasted red pepper dressing

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients.
Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

notes: MAKE IT A MEAL: Add 2 boneless skinless chicken breast halves, grilled or broiled, cut into 1/4 inch slices

recipes.title: Athenos Greek Salad
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe clipping featuring ATHENOS and KRAFT products
recipes.description: A classic Greek salad with mixed greens, olives, tomatoes, cucumber, and feta cheese.

instructions.text: Toss greens, olives, tomatoes, onion and cucumber in large bowl.
Drizzle with dressing; toss to coat. Sprinkle with cheese.

recipes.title: Greek Salsa
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe clipping from ATHENOS product packaging
recipes.description: A Mediterranean-style salsa dip with feta, olives, cucumber, and roasted red peppers. Served with pita chips.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until well blended.
Serve with pita chips.

recipes.title: 7-Layer Taco Dip
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe card from Bob Evans
recipes.description: A hearty layered taco dip with sausage, beans, sour cream, salsa, and all the fixings. Perfect for game day.

instructions.text: In large skillet over medium heat, crumble and cook sausage until browned.
Stir in beans, chilies and taco seasoning mix.
Spread sausage mix into 7" x 11" serving dish.
Top with sour cream, then salsa.
Sprinkle olives, tomato and onion on top. Cover with cheese.
Serve immediately with chips. Refrigerate leftovers.

recipes.title: Bisquick Muffins
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe from Bisquick baking mix box
recipes.description: Simple, quick muffins made with Bisquick baking mix.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F. Grease bottoms of 12 medium muffin cups.
Mix ingredients; beat vigorously 30 seconds.
Fill muffin cups 2/3 full.
Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.

notes: HIGH ALTITUDE: Heat oven to 425°F instead of 400°F

recipes.title: Bisquick Dumplings
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe from Bisquick baking mix box
recipes.description: Simple drop dumplings to add to soups and stews.

instructions.text: Mix ingredients until soft dough forms.
Drop by spoonfuls onto boiling stew.
Cook uncovered over low heat 10 minutes; cover and cook 10 more minutes.

notes: HIGH ALTITUDE: No adjustments needed

recipes.title: Bisquick Drop Biscuits
recipes.source_note: Bisquick box recipe with family handwritten copy
recipes.description: Quick and easy drop biscuits with several variations including no-cholesterol, water-only, and rolled versions.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 450°F.
Mix ingredients until dough forms; beat 30 seconds.
Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake until golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes.

notes: NO-CHOLESTEROL BISCUITS: Mix 2 1/3 cups baking mix and 2/3 cup skim milk or cold water until dough forms; beat 30 sec. Continue as directed.
WATER RECIPE: Mix 2 1/3 cups baking mix and 2/3 cup cold water until dough forms; beat 30 sec. Continue as directed.

ROLLED BISCUITS: After beating, if dough is too sticky, gradually mix in enough baking mix (up to 1/4 cup) to make dough easy to handle. Turn onto surface well dusted with baking mix; gently roll in baking mix to coat. Shape into ball; knead 10 times. Roll 1/2" thick. Cut with 2" cutter dipped in baking mix. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet as directed. 10 to 12 biscuits.
HIGH ALTITUDE: Heat oven to 475°F. If using water, increase baking mix to 2 1/2 cups.
Family handwritten copy of this recipe exists

recipes.title: Country Clay Bread
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe clipping by Linda Wasserstein
recipes.description: A soft, homemade yeast bread baked in a clay bread pan. Uses honey or sugar for a slightly sweet flavor.

instructions.text: Dissolve the yeast in 1/2 cup of warm milk in a large bowl and let stand for 5 minutes. Blend in sugar or honey, salt, melted butter and remaining milk.
Stir in flour, one cup at a time, until ingredients are thoroughly blended and will separate easily from sides of bowl.
Turn dough out onto a floured board, lightly coat with flour. Take care not to use too much flour. Knead for 8 to 10 minutes until dough is soft, satiny and no longer sticky.
Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl and turn dough so all sides are coated with oil. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and place in a warm, draft-free location. Allow to rise for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Punch down the dough and turn it out onto the board. Dust dough sparingly with flour and knead for 1 to 2 minutes. Shape into a loaf.
Brush loaf lightly with oil and place in 1 1/2 quart bread pan. Cover with plastic wrap and allow to rise until dough is 1 inch above top of pan (40-60 minutes).
Pre-heat oven to 350°F. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes.
Remove from oven and run a knife or spatula around inside edges of bread pan. Cool loaf on a wire rack.

notes: Originally designed for Copco Country Clay bread pan
Can use honey instead of sugar for slightly different flavor

recipes.title: Biscuits
recipes.description: Classic homemade biscuits with shortening.

instructions.text: Whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Cut in shortening until you have coarse meal.
Slowly stir in milk until the dough pulls away from side of bowl.
Put on floured surface, knead 15 to 20 times.
Pat into a circle about 1/2 inch thick.
Cut into biscuits with a glass or biscuit cutter dipped in flour.
Bake at 425°F for 13-15 minutes until edges are brown.

notes: Technique tip: Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse meal - this ensures flaky biscuits
Doneness indicator: Slowly stir in milk until the dough pulls away from side of bowl - don't overmix
Kneading: Only knead 15-20 times on floured surface - overworking makes tough biscuits
Cutting tip: Use a glass or biscuit cutter dipped in flour to prevent sticking
Visual doneness: Bake until edges are golden brown
Handwritten family recipe card - treasured technique passed down through generations

recipes.title: Homemade Pie Crust
recipes.source_note: Printed from Libby's Pumpkin Pie Mix packaging
recipes.description: A basic homemade pie crust recipe for a single 9-inch deep-dish pie.

instructions.text: Combine flour and salt in medium bowl.
Cut in vegetable shortening with pastry blender or two knives until mixture is crumbly.
Sprinkle with water; blend until mixture holds together.
Shape dough into ball; place on lightly floured surface.
Roll out dough to 1/8-inch thickness.
Line pie plate with pastry. Turn edge under; crimp edge as desired.

notes: To make two crusts, double all ingredients and divide dough in half

recipes.title: Easy Pumpkin Pie
recipes.source_note: Product label from Libby's Easy Pumpkin Pie Mix
recipes.description: Simple pumpkin pie using Libby's Easy Pumpkin Pie Mix with evaporated milk.

instructions.text: Mix pumpkin pie mix, evaporated milk and eggs in large bowl.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake in preheated 425°F (220°C) oven for 15 minutes.
Reduce temperature to 350°F (175°C); bake for 50-60 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean.
Cool on wire rack for 2 hours. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

notes: Do not freeze, as this will cause the crust to separate from the filling.
See inside label for Pie Baking Tips and Tricks.

recipes.title: Apple-Mincemeat Pie
recipes.description: Orange liqueur, walnuts and mincemeat give this apple pie real holiday personality.

ingredients.prep_note: about 3 lbs., peeled, cored and cut into 1" pieces (about 6 cups)

ingredients.item: orange liqueur, orange juice or rum

instructions.text: For pastry, in bowl combine flour with salt. With pastry blender or two knives, cut in butter and shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in ice water, 1 tbsp at a time, until dough just starts to form. Divide dough in half; shape into 2 disks. Wrap and refrigerate at least 30 minutes.
For filling, preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In bowl combine apples, mincemeat, walnuts and liqueur. Stir in brown sugar and cornstarch. Let stand 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, on lightly floured surface roll out 1 disk of dough to fit 9" pie pan; transfer to pan. Roll out remaining dough into 10" circle.
With pastry wheel or knife cut dough into 1/2"-wide strips.
Spoon apple mixture into pie shell; arrange dough strips over filling in lattice pattern.
Trim and flute edges. Brush milk over dough; sprinkle with granulated sugar. Transfer pie to foil-lined baking sheet.
Bake 50 minutes or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbling. Cool completely on wire rack.

recipes.title: Holiday Brandy Bread
recipes.source_note: Magazine clipping from Woman's World 1/26/96 - title page missing
recipes.description: Sweet yeast bread shaped into half-moons and brushed with brandy butter, dusted with confectioners' sugar.

instructions.text: [Beginning of instructions missing from clipping]
Roll dough into 1/2"-thick ovals. Fold dough over to form half-moon shapes.
Return to buttered baking sheets. Let rise in warm place until almost doubled in bulk, about 1 1/2 hours.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Bake 30 minutes or until loaves are lightly browned and sound hollow when tapped on bottom.
Transfer to wire racks set over baking sheets. In bowl combine remaining brandy and butter; brush over hot loaves.
Cool completely. Sprinkle heavily with confectioners' sugar.

notes: Beginning of recipe missing from clipping - may need additional instructions for dough preparation

flags: Beginning of recipe missing - title and initial instructions unknown

recipes.title: Pfeffernüsse (German Pepper Cookies)
recipes.source_note: Magazine clipping from Woman's World 1/26/96, page 27
recipes.description: Traditional German pepper cookies named for the pepper in every bite. Adjust pepper to suit your taste.

instructions.text: [Mix ingredients and refrigerate dough overnight - beginning of instructions partially obscured]
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Bake 10 minutes or until tops crack.
Roll hot cookies in confectioners' sugar.
Cool completely. Store uncovered 1 week or until cookies harden.

notes: Traditional German Christmas cookie
Store uncovered to allow cookies to harden
Flour amount missing from clipping - likely 2-3 cups

recipes.title: Tortilla Casserole with Chicken and Black Beans
recipes.description: Layered tortilla casserole with chicken, black beans, enchilada sauce, and cheese.

ingredients.prep_note: or substitute cheddar or jack cheese

instructions.text: Spray a 9- by 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray and set aside. Heat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Remove skin from chicken. Cut the meat from the bones and dice. (You should have 1 1/2 - 2 cups.)
Combine the tomatoes and enchilada sauce. Drain the black beans, rinse and drain again. Combine with the chilies and green onions.

Spread a thin layer of the tomato sauce in the bottom of the prepared dish. Tear two of the tortillas in ragged pieces and spread in the pan. Top with the bean mixture. Drizzle with about 1/4 cup tomato sauce.
Tear another two tortillas and place on top of the beans. Spread chicken on top and sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese. Drizzle with 1/4 cup sauce.
Tear the remaining 2 tortillas and place on top. Sprinkle with the olives. Pour remaining sauce over the casserole and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake on center oven rack 35 minutes. Set aside 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Italian Chicken Soup
recipes.source_note: Newspaper/magazine clipping - incomplete, only beginning visible
recipes.description: Italian-style chicken soup.

instructions.text: [INCOMPLETE - instructions cut off from clipping]

recipes.title: Banana Bran Muffins
recipes.description: Moist banana muffins with whole bran.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Stir in bran.
Mix remaining ingredients (egg, banana, milk, oil); add all at once to flour mixture, stirring just to moisten.
Fill greased muffin pans 2/3 full.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20 to 25 minutes.

notes: Sugar amount unclear from fragmented clipping - likely 1/4 to 1/3 cup

flags: Sugar amount unclear from fragmented clipping

recipes.title: Perfect Corn Bread
recipes.description: Classic corn bread with variation for corn sticks.

instructions.text: Sift flour with sugar, baking powder and salt; stir in cornmeal.
Add eggs and shortening. Beat with rotary beater till just smooth. (Do not overmix.)
Pour into greased 9x9x2-inch pan.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 20 to 25 minutes.

notes: For Corn Sticks: Spoon batter into corn-stick pans, filling 2/3 full. Bake at 425°F for 12 to 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Spoon Bread
recipes.description: Soft, souffle-like Southern corn bread served with butter.

instructions.text: Stir 2 cups milk into 1 cup cornmeal to the consistency of mush.
Remove from heat; add 1 cup milk, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 teaspoon each baking powder and salt.
Stir a moderate amount into egg yolks; return to mixture and fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into 2-quart casserole. Bake at 325°F (165°C).
Serve with butter.

notes: Bake time not specified in clipping - typically 45-60 minutes until set

flags: Baking time and exact egg amounts not specified in clipping

recipes.title: Cindy's Fruit Salad (Ambrosia)
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe card on Christmas card
recipes.description: Creamy fruit salad with tropical fruits, coconut, and pecans.

instructions.text: [Instructions not written on card - typical preparation: Drain canned fruits. Whip cream with sugar and vanilla. Fold in sour cream. Combine all fruits, coconut, and pecans. Fold in cream mixture. Refrigerate before serving.]

notes: Family recipe from Mrs Cindy Baker
Christmas card notation: 'Bringing the hope of Jesus to light at Christmas'

flags: Instructions not written on original card - inferred from standard ambrosia preparation
Some ingredient quantities difficult to read in handwriting

recipes.title: Strawberry Jam Dandies
recipes.description: Delicious sandwich cookie flavored with ground almonds, layered with lemon icing, filled with strawberry preserves.

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure almonds, flour, butter, almond extract, and confectioners' sugar. Mix until well blended.
Shape into ball, wrap and refrigerate 2 hours or until dough is firm enough to handle.
Preheat oven to 375°F. On lightly floured surface, roll half of dough 1/8" thick. Cut into rectangles, keeping remaining dough refrigerated.
Place rectangles on cookie sheet, 1/2 inch apart. Bake 10 minutes or until golden. Remove to wire racks to cool completely.
In small bowl, stir lemon juice and confectioners' sugar until smooth. Spread thin layer of icing on cookies without cut-out centers; top each with a cookie with cut-out center.
Fill each of the cut-out centers with strawberry preserves, gently smoothing to edge of the centers.
Store in tightly covered container; use up within 2 days. Just before serving, sprinkle cookies with confectioners' sugar.

recipes.title: Sugar Cookies
recipes.description: Classic rolled sugar cookies decorated with cream and nonpareils.

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure first 8 ingredients. With mixer at medium speed, beat until well mixed, occasionally scraping bowl.
Shape into ball; wrap; refrigerate 3 hours, until easy to handle. Preheat oven to 400°F.
Grease cookie sheets. On floured surface, roll half of dough; refrigerate rest. For crisp cookies, roll paper thin; for soft cookies, roll 1/4-inch thick.
With floured cookie cutters, cut dough into shapes; reroll trimmings and cut more shapes.
Place 1/2 inch apart on cookie sheets. Brush tops with cream; sprinkle with choice of toppings; bake 8 minutes or until very light brown. With pancake turner remove to racks; cool.

recipes.title: Dutch Butter Cookies
recipes.description: Buttery slice-and-bake cookies topped with candied ginger.

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure first 7 ingredients. With mixer at low speed, beat until blended.
With hands, on waxed paper, roll into three 6-inch-long rolls. Flatten each slightly to shape into a bar. Wrap; refrigerate 2 hours or up to 1 week.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease cookie sheets. In cup with fork, beat yolk with water. Slice one roll of dough at a time crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place, 1 inch apart, on cookie sheets.
Brush each cookie with egg-yolk mixture and press chopped ginger into tops.
Bake 10 minutes, until lightly browned. With spatula remove to wire racks to cool.

recipes.title: Snickerdoodles
recipes.description: Classic cinnamon-sugar rolled cookies with crackled tops.

ingredients.prep_note: divided - 1 1/4 cups for dough, 2 tbsp for coating

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure flour, butter, cream of tartar, baking soda, salt, vanilla, eggs, and 1 1/4 cups sugar. With mixer at low speed, beat until blended, occasionally scraping bowl.
Shape dough into a ball; wrap with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 2 hours, until easy to handle.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In small bowl, mix cinnamon with 2 tablespoons sugar.
With hands, shape dough into 1 1/2-inch balls. Roll dough balls in cinnamon mixture to coat lightly.
Place dough balls, about 2 inches apart, on ungreased large cookie sheets. With dull edge of knife, mark each cookie several times if desired.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes until lightly browned. Remove to wire racks to cool.

recipes.title: Molasses Spirals
recipes.description: Spiced molasses cookies piped in a spiral pattern.

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure all ingredients. With mixer at low speed, beat until blended, occasionally scraping bowl with rubber spatula.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease large cookie sheets.
Spoon dough into decorating bag fitted with 1/4-inch writing tube.
For each cookie, pipe dough in a continuous spiral beginning with a 2-inch circle and narrowing the spiral to a point in the center, about 2 inches apart.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes, until golden brown. Remove cookies to wire racks; cool.

notes: Requires piping bag with writing tube

recipes.title: Moravian Ginger Cookies
recipes.description: Traditional thin, crisp ginger cookies from the Pennsylvania Dutch tradition.

instructions.text: In 2-quart saucepan, measure butter, brown sugar, and molasses; cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves and butter melts, stirring mixture occasionally.
Remove from heat, stir in flour and remaining ingredients until well blended. Spoon onto waxed paper; cover and refrigerate 2 hours, until firm enough to roll.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease cookie sheet.
On floured surface with floured rolling pin, roll half of dough into a 10" by 10" square.
With pastry wheel or knife, cut the dough into 2 1/2" by 2 1/2" squares. Place squares about 1 inch apart on greased cookie sheet.
With fork, gently prick squares in many places to make a design. Lightly sprinkle with sugar.
Bake about 7 minutes. With pancake turner, remove cookies to wire racks to cool; repeat with remaining dough.

notes: Traditional Pennsylvania Dutch cookie
The Moravians were quick to use spices brought to the port of Philadelphia

recipes.title: Snickerdoodle Cheesecake Bars
recipes.description: Cinnamon-sugar cheesecake bars with snickerdoodle-style crust.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 325°F. Line 8-inch square baking dish with foil, leaving ends of foil hanging over sides of dish.
Combine flour, 1/4 cup sugar and 1 tbsp cinnamon in medium bowl. Cut in butter with pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Reserve 1/2 cup crumb mixture for later use; press remaining crumb mixture onto bottom and 1/2 inch up sides of dish. Bake 25 min. or until lightly browned.
Meanwhile, beat cream cheese, vanilla and 1/2 cup of the remaining sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing on low speed after each just until blended. Set aside.
Combine remaining sugar (2 tsp) and remaining cinnamon (1/8 tsp).
Pour cream cheese mixture into crust; top with reserved crumb mixture and cinnamon sugar.
Bake 45 to 50 min. or until center of cheesecake is almost set; cool completely.
Refrigerate cheesecake 4 hrs. Use foil handles to remove cheesecake from dish before cutting into bars.

recipes.title: Cream Cheese and Sausage Stuffed Crescents
recipes.description: Savory crescent rolls stuffed with maple sausage and cream cheese.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F.
Crumble sausage links into bite-size pieces; place in large skillet. Cook over medium heat 5 min. or until done, stirring frequently. Drain.
Add sausage to cream cheese and crushed pepper in medium bowl; mix well.
Separate each can of dough into 8 triangles. Spoon cream cheese mixture evenly onto short sides of dough triangles, adding about 2 Tbsp. cream cheese mixture to each triangle.
Roll up, starting at short side of each triangle. Place, point sides down, on baking sheet.
Bake 14 to 16 min. or until golden brown.

notes: Make Ahead: Fill crescent triangles with cream cheese mixture and place on baking sheet as directed; cover. Refrigerate up to 12 hours before baking.

recipes.title: Sourdough Starter
recipes.description: Homemade sourdough starter for bread machine baking.

instructions.text: In a 2 or 3 quart glass bowl, using a wooden or nylon spoon, mix yeast and warm water; let stand 10 minutes.
Add flour; mix until thick batter forms. Batter need not be smooth.
Cover loosely with cheesecloth, lightweight kitchen towel or plastic wrap; let stand in warm place for 24 hours.
Stir; cover loosely. Place starter in a warm place for 2 to 3 days or until it bubbles and smells sour; stir once a day.
Cover loosely with plastic wrap or plastic cover; refrigerate.

notes: To replenish starter: After using a portion, replenish with equal amounts of flour and warm water. Let stand in warm place until bubbly (3-5 hours), then refrigerate.
If not used at the end of one week, remove 1 cup starter and discard; then replenish with equal amounts of flour and warm water.

instructions.text: Measure all ingredients into bread pan. Select Dough setting. Press "Start/Stop".
When unit signals and display reads 0:00, press "Start/Stop" and remove dough.
Divide dough into 6 to 10 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a rope.
Wrap rope around four fingers, moisten ends, overlap and join ends. Turn circle inside out.
Place shaped bagels on greased baking sheet at least 1 inch apart. Cover with lightly dampened cloth.
Allow to rise until puffy, about 30 minutes.
Heat 4 to 6 quarts water to a boil in Dutch oven or stockpot.
Drop 2 to 3 bagels into boiling water. Boil 1-1/2 minutes on each side.
Remove with slotted spoon and drain on towel. Repeat with remaining bagels.
Lightly grease baking sheet or dust with cornmeal to prevent sticking.
Bake in preheated 400°F (204°C) oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
For crispier crust, spritz bagels several times with water during baking.

notes: Dough Setting – Timer OK
Recipe has two sizes: 1.5-Pound and 2-Pound
Boiling before baking is essential for authentic bagel texture

Drain in colander.

notes: Dough Setting – Not for Timer
Only use machine for mixing (8-10 minutes), not full dough cycle

recipes.title: Strawberry Jam (Bread Machine)
recipes.description: Quick homemade strawberry jam made in the bread machine.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients into bread pan.
Select Basic setting. Press "Start/Stop".
Allow to mix 5-6 minutes, scraping sides of pan with rubber spatula.
Press "Start/Stop" to cancel.
Select Bake Setting. Press "Start/Stop".
When unit signals and display reads 0:00, press "Start/Stop".
Using hot pads, remove bread pan.
Pour jam into containers; cover. Refrigerate to set.

notes: Bake Setting – Not for Timer

recipes.title: Orange Marmalade (Bread Machine)
recipes.description: Classic orange marmalade with lemon peel made in the bread machine.

instructions.text: With a vegetable peeler, shave off the bright layer of peel from one orange and lemon; chop finely.
Remove remaining white peel from orange and lemon, discard.
Peel remaining oranges, discard peels. Slice fruit into 1/2-inch pieces.
Combine chopped peels, fruit, sugar and pectin in bread pan.
Select Basic setting. Press "Start/Stop".
Allow to mix 5-6 minutes, scraping sides of pan with rubber spatula.
Press "Start/Stop" to cancel. Select Bake Setting. Press "Start/Stop".
When unit signals and display reads 0:00, press "Start/Stop".
Using hot pads, remove bread pan. Pour jam into containers; cover. Refrigerate to set.

notes: Bake Setting – Not for Timer

recipes.title: Frozen Berry Jam (Bread Machine)
recipes.description: Easy jam using frozen berries - great for year-round jam making.

ingredients.prep_note: 1 package; strawberries and raspberries are ideal

instructions.text: Combine ingredients into bread pan.
Select Basic setting. Press "Start/Stop".
Allow to mix 5-6 minutes, scraping sides of pan with rubber spatula.
Press "Start/Stop" to cancel. Select Bake Setting. Press "Start/Stop".
When unit signals and display reads 0:00, press "Start/Stop".
Using hot pads, remove bread pan. Pour jam into containers; cover. Refrigerate to set.

notes: Bake Setting – Not for Timer
Strawberries and raspberries are ideal for this recipe

recipes.title: Garlic Butter
recipes.description: Simple garlic butter spread for bread.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.

recipes.title: Herb-Cheese Butter
recipes.description: Italian-style herb butter with Parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.

recipes.title: Italian Herb Butter
recipes.description: Quick Italian seasoned butter spread.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.

recipes.title: Choco-Banana Spread
recipes.description: Sweet chocolate and banana spread for toast or bread.

instructions.text: Mix mashed banana with melted chocolate chips.

recipes.title: Ham and Swiss Spread
recipes.description: Savory cream cheese spread with ham and Swiss cheese.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.

recipes.title: Herb-Cream Cheese Spread
recipes.description: Light dill and garlic cream cheese spread.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.

recipes.title: Honey-Walnut Spread
recipes.description: Sweet cream cheese spread with honey and walnuts.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.

recipes.title: Ripe Olive Spread (Tapenade)
recipes.description: Mediterranean-style olive spread with capers and anchovies.

instructions.text: Cover and process all ingredients in food processor or blender until slightly coarse.

recipes.title: Fruited Cream Cheese Spread
recipes.description: Sweet cream cheese spread with fruit preserves.

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese and preserves on medium speed until fluffy.

recipes.title: Whipped Honey-Orange Spread
recipes.description: Light and fluffy honey butter with orange zest.

instructions.text: Beat all ingredients on medium speed until fluffy.

recipes.title: Browned Butter Glaze
recipes.description: Rich glaze with nutty browned butter flavor.

instructions.text: Heat margarine in 1-quart saucepan over medium heat until light brown; cool.
Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla.
Stir in milk until smooth and thin enough to drizzle.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Glaze
recipes.description: Simple cinnamon-flavored drizzle glaze.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until thin enough to drizzle.

recipes.title: Citrus Glaze
recipes.description: Bright citrus glaze with lemon or orange.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until thin enough to drizzle.

recipes.title: Creamy Vanilla Glaze
recipes.description: Classic vanilla drizzle glaze.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until thin enough to drizzle.

recipes.title: Country Corn Bread Dressing
recipes.source_note: Aunt Jemima corn bread mix package
recipes.description: Traditional Southern-style corn bread dressing perfect for stuffing turkey or as a side dish.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F.
Sauté celery and onion in margarine until tender.
Combine celery mixture and remaining ingredients.
Toss lightly until bread is thoroughly moistened.
Place in 8-inch square baking dish or 1-1/2-quart casserole.
Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until heated through.
Alternatively, lightly stuff dressing into body and neck cavities of one 12-pound turkey; roast according to standard roasting directions.

notes: Dressing can also be prepared using 1/2 pan crumbled corn bread (about 3 cups) and 3 cups soft bread cubes
Can be used as stuffing for a 12-pound turkey

recipes.title: Corn Bread (Aunt Jemima)
recipes.source_note: Aunt Jemima corn meal mix package
recipes.description: Classic Southern corn bread using self-rising corn meal mix.

ingredients.item: AUNT JEMIMA Self-Rising Buttermilk Corn Meal Mix

instructions.text: Heat oven to 425°F.
Heat vegetable shortening in 10-inch oven-proof skillet or 8 or 9-inch square baking pan in oven 3 minutes; tilt skillet to coat bottom evenly.
Combine dry ingredients. Add milk and egg; mix until blended.
Add melted shortening; mix well.
Pour into hot skillet; bake 20 to 25 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.

recipes.pan_size: 10-inch skillet or 8-9 inch square baking pan
notes: VARIATION - Muffins or Corn Sticks: Pour batter into 12 greased/paper-lined muffin cups or 21 hot well-greased corn stick pans. Bake 15-20 minutes until golden brown.
VARIATION - Buttermilk Corn Bread: Add 1/2 tsp baking soda to dry ingredients. Substitute buttermilk for milk.

VARIATION - Tex-Mex Corn Bread: Stir in one 8-oz can whole kernel corn (drained) and one 4-oz can chopped green chilies (drained). Bake 25-30 minutes. Top with 1/2 cup shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese.

recipes.title: Seasoned Corn Meal Coating
recipes.source_note: Aunt Jemima corn meal mix package
recipes.description: Crispy seasoned coating for pan fried fish or oven fried chicken.

ingredients.item: AUNT JEMIMA Self-Rising Buttermilk Corn Meal Mix

instructions.text: FOR PAN FRIED FISH: Combine dry ingredients in mixing bowl. Coat 1-pound fish filets in dry ingredients. Dip in milk; coat again in dry ingredients. Heat 2-3 tbsp vegetable oil in large skillet over medium heat. Fry 2-3 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily with fork. (4 servings)

FOR OVEN FRIED CHICKEN: Preheat oven to 375°F. Combine dry ingredients in mixing bowl. Dip 2-1/2 pound cut-up broiler/fryer chicken in milk, then into dry ingredients. Place chicken skin side up on 15x10-inch jelly roll pan; lightly brush with 3 tbsp melted margarine or butter. Bake 50-55 minutes or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced with fork. (6 servings)

notes: Can be used for fish or chicken

recipes.title: Cranberry Salad
recipes.description: Traditional cranberry gelatin salad with pineapple and nuts - a holiday classic.

instructions.text: Add juice of pineapple to the unflavored gelatin to dissolve.
Dissolve Jello in hot water, add cold water.
Grind cranberries in a food processor.
Add sugar to cranberries, mix well.
When Jello begins to thicken, fold in cranberry mix and remainder of ingredients.
Pour into a large mold or serving dish.

recipes.title: Apple Pie Filling
recipes.description: Homemade apple pie filling made with cinnamon, sugar and lemons - ready in just 30 minutes. Great for pies or canning.

instructions.text: Toss apple slices with lemon juice as soon as you've cut them and add to large dutch oven with water.
Whisk in the sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg until well combined.
Bring to a boil on high heat then lower to medium heat and simmer until apples are softened and sauce has thickened, about 8-10 minutes.
Cool completely before using in a recipe (especially pie) or canning.

notes: 125 kcal per serving
Can be used for pie filling or canning

recipes.title: Homemade Apple Pie Filling (Dorothy Kern)
recipes.description: Easy apple pie filling that tastes better than canned. Can be frozen for later use.

instructions.text: Place apples in a large bowl and toss with lemon juice.
Place water, sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg in a medium saucepan. Stir to combine then bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring often.
Once the mixture boils, boil it for two minutes. Add the apples, turn to a simmer, and cover.
Cook, stirring often, until the apples soften, about 5-8 minutes.
Pour into jars to cool to room temperature then cover and refrigerate. The mixture will thicken more as it cools.

notes: 133 kcal per serving
Can be frozen for later use

flags: Cinnamon amount (1/4 cup) seems unusually high - verify if should be 1/4 tsp

recipes.title: Butter Pie Crust
recipes.description: Pie crust from scratch that makes a pie extra special. Flavorful, flaky, easy to handle and bakes beautifully.

instructions.text: Combine flour and salt in bowl; cut in butter with pastry blender or fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in enough water with fork, just until flour is moistened.
Divide dough in half; shape each half into ball. Flatten slightly. Wrap 1 ball in plastic food wrap; refrigerate.

FOR 1-CRUST PIE: Roll out 1 ball of dough on lightly floured surface into 12-inch circle. Fold into quarters. Place dough in 9-inch pie pan; unfold dough, pressing firmly against bottom and sides. Trim crust to 1/2 inch from edge of pan. Crimp or flute edge. Fill and bake according to pie recipe directions.

FOR 2-CRUST PIE: Roll out remaining ball of dough on lightly floured surface into 12-inch circle. Fold dough into quarters. Place dough over filling; unfold. Trim, seal and crimp or flute edge. Cut 5 or 6 slits in crust. Bake according to pie recipe directions.
FOR BAKED UNFILLED PIE SHELL: Prepare dough as directed for 1-crust pie. Prick crust all over with fork before baking. Bake at 475°F for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.

recipes.title: Rice Krispie Tree Trimmer Treats
recipes.description: Fun Christmas ornament-shaped Rice Krispies treats with licorice hangers and candy decorations.

instructions.text: Fold each licorice piece in half and push ends through centers of 12 miniature marshmallows. Set aside.
In large saucepan melt butter over low heat. Add 10 ounces marshmallows and stir until completely melted.
Remove from heat. Add Kellogg's Rice Krispies cereal. Stir until well coated.
Using 1/3 cup measuring cup coated with cooking spray, divide warm cereal mixture into 12 portions.
Using buttered hands, shape each portion into ornament shape around licorice ends.
Cool. Decorate with frosting and M&M's brand chocolate candies.

notes: Best if served the same day

recipes.title: Pizza Biscuit Wreath
recipes.description: Festive wreath-shaped appetizer made with biscuit dough stuffed with pepperoni and cheese, served with pizza sauce.

ingredients.item: Pillsbury Grands Jr. Golden Layers Buttermilk Biscuits

ingredients.prep_note: 1/2 inch; about 5 sticks at 3/4 oz each, cut crosswise into 4 pieces

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F. Spray large cookie sheet with cooking spray.
Separate 1 can of dough into 10 biscuits; keep second can refrigerated.
Press each biscuit into a 3-inch round. Place 3 pepperoni slices (or 6 mini pepperoni slices) and 1 piece of cheese on each dough round.
Wrap dough around filling, pinching edges to seal and form ball. Repeat with remaining can of dough, pepperoni, and cheese.
Leaving a 4-inch hole in center, arrange 8 balls, seam side down and sides almost touching, into ring on cookie sheet.
Arrange remaining 12 balls, sides almost touching, around outer edge of first ring.
Brush rings with beaten egg. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and Italian seasoning.
Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Meanwhile, in small microwavable bowl, microwave pizza sauce, loosely covered, on high 45 to 60 seconds or until warm.
Carefully slide wreath from cookie sheet onto serving platter. Place bowl of pizza sauce in center of wreath. Garnish with fresh oregano if desired. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Slow Cooker Sausage Breakfast Casserole
recipes.description: Easy overnight breakfast casserole with hash browns, sausage, eggs, and cheese made in the slow cooker.

instructions.text: Spray a 6-quart slow cooker with cooking spray.
Layer half of the potatoes on the bottom of slow cooker.
Top with half of the sausage, mozzarella and Parmesan cheese, sun-dried tomatoes and green onion.
Repeat layering.
Beat eggs, milk, salt, and pepper in large bowl with a whisk until well blended.
Pour evenly over potato-sausage mixture.
Cook on low setting for 8 hours, or on high setting for 4 hours, or until eggs are set.

recipes.title: Cheesy Bacon Bombs
recipes.description: Deep-fried bacon-wrapped biscuit bites stuffed with gooey mozzarella cheese.

ingredients.item: Pillsbury Grands Flaky Layers Original Biscuits

instructions.text: Cube the cheese, and cut each biscuit into fourths.
Place one piece of cheese inside a biscuit quarter, and tightly roll it.
Wrap each rolled Bomb in a slice of bacon, and secure it with a skewer or toothpick.
In a medium-large pot, heat approximately 2 inches of oil to 350°F.
Fry the Bombs in small batches (maybe one or two at a time). The oil will expand, so stay close.
Drain Bombs on a paper towel. Serve warm.

notes: Oil will expand during frying - stay close and fry in small batches

recipes.title: Captain Morgan Spiced Rum Cocktail
recipes.description: Refreshing rum cocktail with cranberry and lime.

instructions.text: In an ice-filled Collins or rocks glass, combine all the ingredients.
Stir to blend.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

notes: Contains alcohol

recipes.title: Bailey's Peppermint Cream
recipes.description: Festive hot cocoa spiked with Irish cream and topped with crushed candy cane.

instructions.text: Mix Bailey's Original Irish Cream Liqueur and hot cocoa.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream.
Sprinkle crushed candy cane on top.
Garnish with mint leaf (optional).

notes: Contains alcohol
Perfect for holiday gatherings

recipes.title: Holiday Sangria
recipes.description: Festive white wine sangria with cranberries and apple.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a large pitcher.
Refrigerate for one hour or until ready to use.
Add citrus slices as a festive garnish.

notes: Contains alcohol

recipes.title: Cranberry Delight Punch
recipes.description: Festive cranberry slush punch with frozen juice concentrates and lemon-lime soda.

ingredients.item: Sierra Mist Lemon Lime or Cranberry Splash Soda

instructions.text: Blend the cranberry sauce, frozen juice concentrates, and spices into a blender on low until fully incorporated.
Transfer the mixture into a large mixing bowl. Add the water and mix until fully incorporated.
Split the mixture between two 1-gallon freezer bags and place into the freezer.
After 2 hours, knead the concentrate inside the bag and replace into the freezer overnight.
To serve, thaw the mixture in the freezer bag until it can be easily scooped.
Place 1/2 cup of slush and 1/2 cup of Sierra Mist into a cup.
Garnish with fresh cranberries and cinnamon sticks.

notes: Non-alcoholic
Make ahead - freeze overnight

recipes.title: Fully-Loaded Mashed-Potato Pizza
recipes.description: Quick flatbread appetizer loaded with mashed potatoes, cheese, bacon, and sour cream.

ingredients.item: Flatout Rustic White Thin Crust Flatbread

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F. Place Flatout Flatbread on a cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for two minutes. Remove flatbread from oven.
Spread the mashed potatoes on the flatbread.
Evenly distribute the cheese and bacon on the potatoes.
Return flatbread to oven. Bake at 350°F for four minutes.
Remove from oven. Top with sour cream and chives.

recipes.title: Cranberry Orange Pecan Butter Roll
recipes.description: Festive compound butter with cranberries, orange zest, and pecans - perfect for holiday bread.

instructions.text: Divide the dried cranberries and pecans in half. Place 1/4 cup of cranberries and 1/4 cup of pecans in a small bowl and set aside.
Combine the butter, 1/4 cup cranberries, zest and 1/4 cup of pecans in a large mixing bowl.
Place the butter mixture onto a 12" x 12" piece of wax paper.
Fold the top of the wax paper over the butter mixture and press into a log shape.
Place the butter log into the freezer for 30 minutes to harden.
Remove the butter from the freezer and remove the wax paper.
Roll the butter in the remaining mixture of cranberries and pecan until the outside is fully coated.
Refrigerate until needed.

notes: Great for holiday entertaining
Can be made ahead

recipes.title: Holiday Surprise Punch
recipes.description: Festive punch with ginger ale ice cubes containing maraschino cherries and a hint of peppermint.

instructions.text: Place one cherry in each cube of an ice tray and fill with Canada Dry Ginger Ale. Freeze overnight.
Combine chilled juices in punch bowl.
Add peppermint extract and stir.
Add Canada Dry Ginger Ale ice cubes to each glass.

notes: Non-alcoholic
Ice cubes need to freeze overnight

recipes.title: Italian Meatball Sliders
recipes.description: Quick and easy meatball sliders with marinara and melted cheese.

ingredients.item: ciabatta, whole wheat, or sour dough buns, or dinner rolls

instructions.text: Combine meatballs and marinara sauce in a microwave safe bowl.
Microwave 1 minute or until warmed; toss to coat meatballs evenly with sauce.
Spoon meatballs over bottom of rolls; top with cheese and close sliders.

recipes.title: Tex-Mex Meatball Nacho Bites
recipes.description: Meatballs served in tortilla chip scoops with all the nacho fixings.

instructions.text: Cook meatballs in oven per package instructions.
Lay out tortilla chips on plate and fill with shredded lettuce.
Place a small tablespoon of salsa on bed of lettuce and add one meatball.
Top with a small dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with shredded cheese.
Repeat for all meatballs.

recipes.title: Mushroom Meatballs
recipes.description: Stuffed mushrooms with meatballs and beef gravy, topped with Parmesan.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Remove stems from mushrooms and place on a cookie sheet.
Place 1 Tbsp. of gravy and one frozen meatball in each mushroom cap.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Jalapeño Pigs in a Blanket
recipes.description: Mini smokies wrapped in crescent rolls with spicy jalapeño cream cheese.

ingredients.item: Philadelphia Spicy Jalapeño Cream Cheese Spread

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F.
Unroll dough into 8 triangles; cut each triangle lengthwise into thirds.
Spread triangles evenly with cream cheese spread.
Top each with a Smokie; roll up.
Place, point-sides down, on baking sheet.
Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.

recipes.title: Smoky Bacon Ranch Dip
recipes.description: Creamy ranch dip with smoky chipotle peppers and crispy bacon.

ingredients.item: Hidden Valley Ranch Dip Seasoning Mix

instructions.text: Remove 2 chipotle peppers from the can and dice into 1/4" pieces.
In a mixing bowl blend the sour cream, ranch seasoning mix, and peppers together.
Cook the bacon until crispy, drain on paper towels.
Chop the bacon into small pieces and reserve a small amount for garnish.
Mix the chopped bacon into the sour cream mixture.
Eat immediately or place in fridge for a couple of hours to allow flavors to meld together.

notes: Can be made ahead and refrigerated

recipes.title: Pecan Pie Cheesecake
recipes.description: A combination of creamy cheesecake and pecan pie in one dessert.

instructions.text: Combine cream cheese, 1 egg, 1/3 cup sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat until light and fluffy.
Spread cream cheese mixture over bottom of unbaked pie shell.
Arrange pecan halves over cream cheese layer.
Combine 2 eggs, 1/4 cup sugar, corn syrup, and 1/2 tsp vanilla; pour over pecans.
Bake until set (approximately 350°F for 35-40 minutes - verify temperature).

notes: Difficulty: 3 out of 5
Good for Thanksgiving

flags: Directions partially cut off in original - standard pecan pie cheesecake method assumed

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pecan Cheesecake
recipes.description: Rich pumpkin cheesecake with a pecan crumble topping - perfect for Thanksgiving.

instructions.text: FOR TOPPING: Place sugar in small bowl. Add butter and cut in until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir pecans into mixture and set aside.
FOR CHEESECAKE: Blend graham cracker crumbs, 1/4 cup sugar and the melted butter in medium bowl.
Press crumb mixture in bottom and up sides of 9 inch springform pan. Chill.
Preheat oven to 325°F.
Using electric mixer, beat cream cheese in large bowl until smooth.
Mix in remaining sugar and brown sugar. Add eggs, one at a time, beat until fluffy.
Blend in pumpkin, cream and spices. Pour into crust.
Bake about 1-1/2 hours until center no longer moves when pan is shaken.
Sprinkle topping over cheesecake. Bake 15 minutes more.
Cool. Cover and chill overnight. Serve with whipped topping.

notes: Chill overnight before serving

recipes.title: Pecan Crunch
recipes.description: Buttery shortbread bars topped with chocolate and toasted pecans.

instructions.text: Into large bowl, measure first 5 ingredients. With hand, knead dough until well blended and it holds together.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Pat dough evenly into 15-1/2" by 10-1/2" jelly-roll pan. Bake 25 minutes.
In small saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate, stirring frequently; set aside.
Remove pan from oven; pour chocolate over baked layer; with spatula, evenly spread over; sprinkle with pecans. Cool on wire rack.
When cool, cut lengthwise into 6 strips, cut each strip crosswise into 12 pieces. Store in tightly-covered container; use up within 1 week.

notes: 75 calories per bar
Can begin 2 hrs or up to 1 week ahead

recipes.title: Apricot Meringue Strips
recipes.description: Delicate shortbread base with apricot preserves and walnut meringue topping.

ingredients.prep_note: divided (1/4 cup for base, 1/4 cup for meringue)

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Into small bowl, measure flour, butter, vanilla, salt, egg yolk, and 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar.
With mixer at low speed, beat until blended, occasionally scraping bowl with rubber spatula. Evenly spread mixture onto bottom of ungreased 8" by 8" baking pan; bake 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, in another small bowl with mixer at high speed, beat egg white until soft peaks form.
Beating at high speed, gradually beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar until stiff, glossy peaks form; fold in nuts.
Remove from oven. Spread apricot preserves over baked layer; top with meringue. Bake 20 minutes, until lightly browned.
Cool on wire rack 15 minutes; cut into 4" by 1" fingers; cool completely.

notes: 95 calories per cookie
Can begin 2 hrs or up to 3 days ahead

recipes.title: Crunchy Snack Bars
recipes.description: Easy-to-make, crunchy bar cookies using condensed milk with a chocolate and oat base.

instructions.text: In double boiler over hot (not boiling) water, heat chocolate pieces, sweetened condensed milk, and 3 tablespoons butter, stirring occasionally, until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Stir in 3/4 cup chopped nuts and 1 teaspoon vanilla; remove from heat; keep mixture warm.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease 13" by 9" baking pan.
Into large bowl, measure flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, eggs, 1 cup butter, and 1 tablespoon vanilla.
With mixer at low speed, beat until mixed, scraping bowl. Increase speed to medium; beat 3 minutes. Stir in oats and rest of nuts.
Pat half of dough onto bottom of pan. Spread chocolate over dough; drop remaining dough by teaspoonfuls to cover chocolate mixture.
Bake 45 minutes or until top is firm when lightly touched. Cool completely in pan on wire rack.

notes: 215 calories per bar
Can begin 3 hrs ahead or early in day

recipes.title: Peanut-Choco Nuggets
recipes.description: Rich cookies with chocolate-peanut butter filling wrapped in buttery cookie dough.

instructions.text: Prepare Chocolate Filling: In heavy 2-quart saucepan over low heat, heat chocolate pieces until melted and smooth, stirring often.
Remove saucepan from heat; stir in peanut butter, coconut, peanuts, and 1/3 cup confectioners' sugar until blended.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Shape into mounds. Cover; refrigerate 30 minutes.
Prepare Cookie-Shell Dough: Knead flour, butter, vanilla, and 1 cup confectioners' sugar until blended and stiff.
Shape dough into 25-inch log. Cut into 50 half-inch slices. Preheat oven to 400°F.
Place chocolate filling on dough slice; wrap dough around filling, pinching edges to seal.
Shape into 2-inch logs; place on ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 10-12 minutes until golden. Cool on wire racks.
Roll cooled cookies in confectioners' sugar. Store in tightly-covered container.

notes: 130 calories per cookie
Can make 2 hrs to 1 week ahead

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Candy-Tops
recipes.description: Peanut butter cookies topped with chocolate-covered peanuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F. Beat all ingredients except candies until well blended.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 12 minutes.
Remove from oven, quickly press 3 or 4 candies into tops; return to oven; bake 3 minutes.
Remove to wire racks; cool.

notes: 68 calories per cookie

recipes.title: Almond Lace Rolls
recipes.description: Delicate, crispy almond cookies rolled into elegant tubes.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour large cookie sheet.
In large skillet, combine all ingredients except confectioners' sugar. Cook over low heat, stirring, until butter melts and mixture is blended.
Keeping over very low heat, drop 4 heaping teaspoonfuls, 2 inches apart, onto cookie sheet; bake 5 minutes.
With metal spatula, quickly remove cookies, one by one, and immediately roll around wooden spoon handle.
Cool; repeat until all batter is used, greasing and flouring cookie sheet each time.
To serve, dust with confectioners' sugar.

notes: 64 calories per cookie
Work quickly - cookies harden fast

recipes.title: Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.description: Classic oatmeal cookies with walnuts and raisins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease large cookie sheet.
In large bowl, measure first 9 ingredients. With mixer at low speed, beat until well blended, scraping bowl with rubber spatula.
With spoon, stir in oats, walnuts, and raisins.
Drop dough by heaping tablespoonfuls, 2 inches apart, onto cookie sheet; bake 12 minutes.
With metal spatula, remove cookies to wire racks to cool. Repeat until all dough is used, greasing cookie sheet each time.

recipes.title: Coconut Macaroons
recipes.description: Light, fluffy coconut macaroons with a crispy exterior.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F. Lightly grease two cookie sheets.
In small bowl with mixer at high speed, beat egg whites until soft peaks form.
At high speed, beat in sugar, 2 tablespoons at a time, beating well after each addition until completely dissolved.
Beat in vanilla and salt; whites should stand in stiff, glossy peaks.
With rubber spatula, gently fold in coconut and flour.
Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls, 1 inch apart, onto cookie sheets; bake 20 minutes, until lightly browned.
With metal spatula, carefully remove cookies to wire racks; cool.

notes: 38 calories per cookie
Can make 2 hrs to 3 days ahead

recipes.title: Jolly Santas Cookies
recipes.description: Decorated sugar cookies shaped into Santa faces for Christmas.

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure all ingredients except frosting and currants. With mixer at low speed, beat until blended. Shape into a ball; wrap and refrigerate 3 hours.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease large cookie sheet. Roll one-third of dough 1/8-inch thick on floured surface, keeping remaining dough refrigerated.
With floured 3-inch round cookie cutter, cut into rounds. Place on cookie sheet, 1 inch apart.
Bake 12 minutes, until lightly browned. Immediately remove to wire racks; cool. Repeat with remaining dough.
Decorate cookies: With frosting, attach 2 currants on each for eyes, decorate with red and white frostings to make Santa faces. Let frosting dry.

notes: 140 calories per cookie

recipes.title: Gingerbread Men
recipes.description: Pennsylvania Dutch spice cookies - a Christmastime favorite. Fun to decorate with children.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. In large bowl, measure all ingredients except frosting. With mixer at low speed, beat until well mixed. Shape dough into a ball; wrap and refrigerate 1 hour or until firm (or freeze 30 minutes).
On lightly floured surface with floured rolling pin, roll dough 1/4-inch thick.
With 4-1/2-inch gingerbread man cookie cutter, cut out as many cookies as possible.
Place cookies about 1/2 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
Re-roll trimmings and cut again. Bake 8 minutes or until browned. Remove to wire racks to cool.
With frosting in decorating bag fitted with small writing tube, decorate cookies. Let frosting dry. Store in tightly-covered container.

notes: 140 calories per cookie
Use within 1 week

recipes.title: Chocolate Fudge
recipes.description: Classic homemade chocolate fudge with walnuts. Includes variations for Peanut Butter Fudge and Chocolate-Marshmallow Fudge.

instructions.text: In large saucepan over medium heat, heat sugar, milk, corn syrup, and unsweetened chocolate to boiling, stirring constantly.
Set candy thermometer in place and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until temperature reaches 238°F (soft ball stage).
Remove from heat; immediately add butter and vanilla extract.
Cool mixture, without stirring, to 110°F, or until outside of saucepan feels lukewarm. Meanwhile, butter 8" x 8" baking pan.
With spoon, beat until mixture becomes thick and begins to lose its gloss. Quickly stir in nuts; pour into pan. (Don't scrape saucepan; mixture on side may be sugary.)
Cool in pan; when cold, cut into 32 squares.

notes: 122 calories per piece
VARIATION - Peanut Butter Fudge: Use 1/4 cup creamy peanut butter instead of butter; substitute 1 cup chopped salted peanuts for walnuts. 160 cals per piece.
VARIATION - Chocolate-Marshmallow Fudge: Stir in 1 cup miniature marshmallows just before pouring into pan. 126 cals per piece.

recipes.title: Candy Apples
recipes.description: Classic red candy-coated apples on sticks, perfect for Halloween or fall festivities.

instructions.text: Early in day: Wash and thoroughly dry apples; carefully insert a wooden stick part way through stem end of each. Grease large cookie sheet; set aside.
In medium saucepan over medium heat, heat remaining ingredients to boiling, stirring frequently until sugar and candies are dissolved.

Set candy thermometer in place and continue cooking, without stirring, until temperature reaches 290°F or until a small amount of mixture dropped into very cold water separates into thin, hard threads, about 20 minutes.

Immediately remove syrup from heat and dip in apples: Tip saucepan and swirl each apple in mixture to coat evenly; lift out apple and swirl over saucepan a few more seconds to catch drips. Place apples on greased cookie sheet to cool. Work quickly before syrup hardens; if it does harden, place over very low heat to soften. Cool apples for at least 1 hour before serving.

notes: Begin early in the day
416 calories per apple

recipes.title: Peanut Brittle
recipes.description: Classic American candy that became popular at the end of the 19th century.

instructions.text: Grease large cookie sheet. In heavy 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, heat first 4 ingredients to boiling, stirring until the sugar is dissolved, stir in nuts. Carefully set a candy thermometer in place and continue cooking, stirring frequently, until temperature reaches 300°F, or hard-crack stage (when a small amount of mixture dropped into a bowl of very cold water separates into hard and brittle threads), 20 minutes.
Remove saucepan from heat; immediately stir in the butter or margarine and baking soda; pour the hot mixture at once onto prepared cookie sheet.
With two forks, lift and pull the peanut mixture into a rectangle about 14" by 12"; set aside to cool completely.
With hands, snap candy into small pieces. Store in tightly-covered container to use up within 1 week.

notes: 146 calories per ounce
Begin 1 hour or up to 1 day ahead

recipes.title: Pepperoni Bites
recipes.description: Golden biscuits filled with saucy pizza filling - an easy appetizer.

instructions.text: For filling, in a bowl combine mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, and pizza sauce. Set aside.
Separate biscuits. Flatten biscuits to 3-inch circles. Place about 1 rounded tablespoon filling in the center of each circle.
Bring edges of dough together. Pinch to seal. Place, seam side down, on greased baking sheets. Brush with milk. Sprinkle with Parmesan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

notes: Easy recipe
Great party appetizer

recipes.title: Crunchy Party Mix
recipes.description: Classic crispy snack mix with pretzels, cereals, and nuts.

ingredients.item: bite-size wheat or bran square cereal
bite-size rice or corn square cereal

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix margarine, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and pepper sauce. Heat and stir till margarine melts.
In a large roasting pan mix pretzels, cereals, and nuts. Drizzle margarine mixture over cereal mixture; toss to coat.
Bake in a 300° oven for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes.
Spread on foil to cool. Store in airtight container.

notes: Can freeze for up to four months
Oriental-Style: Omit Worcestershire and pretzels. Add 3 tbsp soy sauce and 2 tsp five-spice powder. Add chow mein noodles and fish crackers.
Italian-Style: Omit hot pepper sauce. Increase garlic to 1 tsp. Add 2 tsp Italian seasoning. Toss with Parmesan after baking.
Cajun-Style: Increase hot pepper sauce to 1 tbsp. Use pecan halves instead of mixed nuts.

recipes.title: Toasted Chili Nuts
recipes.description: Spicy roasted nuts with chili powder and Worcestershire sauce.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine margarine, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, onion salt, and red pepper. Heat and stir till margarine melts.
Spread nuts in a 9x9x2-inch baking pan. Toss with margarine mixture.
Bake in a 350° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till toasted, stirring occasionally.
Spread on foil; cool. Store in an airtight container.

notes: FAST recipe

recipes.title: Nachos
recipes.description: Seven-layer spicy snack with meat, beans, and melted cheese.

ingredients.item: bulk pork sausage or ground beef

instructions.text: Cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown. Drain. Stir in beans.
Arrange half of the chips on each of two 12-inch ovenproof platters.
Layer half of the meat-bean mixture, olives, chili peppers, and cheese on each platter.
Bake in a 350° oven for 5 to 7 minutes or till cheese melts.
Serve with avocado dip, dairy sour cream, and salsa, if desired.

notes: Microwave option: cook meat, onion, garlic in 2-quart casserole on high 3-5 minutes. Assemble and microwave on high 2-3 minutes.

recipes.title: Italian-Style Popcorn
recipes.description: Great to munch in front of the TV - seasoned popcorn with Italian herbs and Parmesan.

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook and stir margarine, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder till margarine melts.
Toss with popcorn, coating evenly. Toss with cheese.

notes: FAST recipe
Cajun-Style variation: Omit Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and Parmesan. Add 1 tsp paprika, 1/4 tsp garlic salt, and 1/8 tsp each ground white, red, and black pepper to the margarine.

recipes.title: Potato Skins
recipes.description: Crispy baked potato skins topped with cheese, served with salsa and green onion.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Prick potatoes with a fork. Bake in a 425° oven for 40 to 50 minutes or till tender. Cut into quarters.
Scoop out the insides (reserve for another use), leaving 1/2-inch-thick shells.
Brush both sides of potato skins with margarine. Place, cut side up, on a large baking sheet.
Bake in a 425° oven for 10 to 15 minutes or till crisp. Sprinkle with cheese and, if desired, salt.
Bake about 2 minutes more or till cheese melts. Serve with salsa and green onion.

notes: Make potato shells ahead, then bake or fry just before serving
Fried variation: Omit margarine, don't bake second time. Deep fry shells at 375° for 1-2 minutes till golden. Drain, add cheese, bake 2 minutes.

recipes.title: Stuffed Mushrooms
recipes.description: Delectable morsels filled with cheddar or blue cheese.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar or crumbled blue cheese

instructions.text: Wash and drain mushrooms. Remove stems. Reserve caps. Chop enough stems to make 1 cup.
In a medium saucepan cook stems, onion, and garlic in margarine or butter till tender.
Stir in bread crumbs and cheese. Spoon crumb mixture into mushroom caps.
Arrange mushrooms in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 425° oven 8 to 10 minutes or till heated through.

notes: Spinach-Stuffed: Add 1 cup chopped fresh spinach, 1/4 cup Parmesan, 1/2 tsp marjoram
Sausage-Stuffed: Omit butter/cheese. Use 2 tbsp crumbs. Cook 1/2 lb Italian sausage with stems. Add 2 tbsp Parmesan.
Pepperoni-Stuffed: Omit cheese. Add 1/4 cup chopped pepperoni, 1/2 tsp Italian seasoning
Ham-Stuffed: Use corn bread stuffing mix, omit cheese. Add 1/4 cup ham, 2 tbsp pecans

recipes.title: Creamy Dill Dip
recipes.description: Serve with carrot sticks, broccoli, cauliflower floweters, and mushrooms.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl beat cream cheese, sour cream, onion, dillweed, and seasoned salt with an electric mixer till fluffy.
Chill up to 24 hours. If dip thickens after chilling, stir in 1 or 2 tablespoons milk.
Serve with vegetable dippers, crackers, or chips.

notes: Creamy Onion Dip: Omit onion, dillweed, salt. Add 2 tbsp regular onion soup mix.
Creamy Blue Cheese Dip: Omit dillweed and salt. Add 1/2 cup crumbled blue cheese and 1/3 cup chopped walnuts.
Creamy Seafood Dip: Add one 6 1/2-oz can minced clams or crabmeat, drained.
Creamy Tarragon Dip: Omit dillweed and salt. Add 1/2 cup watercress, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp anchovy paste, 1/2 tsp crushed dried tarragon.

recipes.title: Sour Cream Fruit Dip
recipes.description: To keep the fruit looking just-picked, brush it with lemon juice.

ingredients.item: dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

instructions.text: Stir together sour cream, preserves (cut up large pieces of fruit), and cinnamon.
Chill up to 24 hours. Serve with fruit.

notes: EASY recipe

recipes.title: Chili con Queso
recipes.description: Classic Tex-Mex cheese dip with tomatoes and green chiles.

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion in margarine till tender.
Stir in tomatoes and peppers. Simmer, uncovered, 10 minutes.
Toss cheeses with cornstarch. Gradually add to saucepan, stirring till melted.
Stir in hot sauce. Heat through. Serve with chips.

notes: Microwave option available

recipes.title: Hot Cheese Dip
recipes.description: Warm cheese dip made with beer and tarragon.

ingredients.item: French bread cubes or tortilla chips

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion, garlic, and tarragon in margarine.
Stir in cornstarch. Add beer all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Gradually add cheeses, stirring till melted.
Serve with bread or chips.

notes: EASY recipe

recipes.title: Guacamole
recipes.description: Fiery chili peppers and creamy, cool avocados pair up in this Mexican favorite.

ingredients.prep_note: drained, or use several dashes hot pepper sauce

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine avocados, onion, chili peppers or hot pepper sauce, cilantro, lemon juice, garlic, and salt.
Cover and blend or process till mixture is smooth, scraping sides as necessary.
Stir in tomato, if desired. Transfer to a serving bowl.
Cover and chill up to 24 hours. Serve with chips.

recipes.title: Cheese and Pesto Spread
recipes.description: Elegant layered cheese spread with homemade pesto.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese and Brie cheese.

For pesto, in a blender container combine basil, parsley, Parmesan cheese, nuts, garlic, and 2 tablespoons oil. Cover; blend with on-off turns till a paste forms. Gradually add remaining oil, blending on low speed till smooth.
Beat cream cheese and Brie together till nearly smooth. Beat whipping cream till soft peaks form. Fold whipped cream into cheese mixture.
Line a 3 1/2- or 4-cup mold with plastic wrap. Spread one-fourth of cheese mixture into mold. Top with one-third of pesto. Repeat layers twice. Top with cheese mixture.
Chill 6 to 24 hours. To serve, unmold on plate. Remove plastic wrap. Garnish with fresh basil, if desired. Serve with crackers.

recipes.title: Cheddar Cheese Ball
recipes.description: Skip last-minute hassle by making this appetizer ahead and freezing it.

instructions.text: Bring cheddar cheese, cream cheese, and margarine to room temperature. Add milk, onion, pimiento, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce.
Beat till combined. Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, shape mixture into a ball. Roll in parsley or nuts. Let stand 15 minutes.
Garnish with pimiento strips, if desired. Serve with crackers.

notes: Blue Cheese Ball: Omit pimiento and parsley. Add 1/4 cup crumbled blue cheese. Roll in chopped toasted almonds.
Deviled-Ham-and-Cheese Ball: Substitute Swiss cheese for cheddar and omit Worcestershire. Add one 3-oz can deviled ham.

recipes.title: Feta Cheese Ball
recipes.description: Mediterranean-style cheese ball with feta and olives.

instructions.text: Bring cheeses and margarine to room temperature. Beat till combined.
Stir in olives and onion. Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, shape into a ball. Roll in parsley or almonds. Serve with crackers.

recipes.title: Eight-Layer Spread
recipes.description: For variety, add a ninth layer of alfalfa sprouts.

ingredients.item: shredded Monterey Jack or cheddar cheese

instructions.text: Stir together beans and picante or taco sauce.
Arrange lettuce on a 12-inch platter, leaving a 2-inch open rim at edge of platter.
Spread bean mixture over lettuce, making a layer about 1/4 inch thick.
Then layer sour cream and avocado dip. Top with cheese, onion, and olives.
Cover and chill up to 24 hours. Before serving, arrange tomatoes on top. Arrange chips on platter around spread.

recipes.title: Cream-Cheese-Stuffed Slices
recipes.description: French bread stuffed with herbed cream cheese, sliced for serving.

instructions.text: Trim ends from rolls. Carefully scoop out centers, leaving 1/2-inch-thick shells. Reserve centers for another use.
In a bowl combine cream cheese, sour cream, onion or chives, pimiento, parsley, and seasoned salt. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed till smooth.
Stuff bread shells with cheese mixture, pressing firmly to prevent air pockets.
Wrap in foil or plastic wrap. Chill 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, cut rolls into 1/2-inch slices.

notes: Bacon-Stuffed Slices: Omit pimiento and seasoned salt. Stir 4 slices crumbled, cooked bacon into the cream cheese mixture.

recipes.title: Shrimp-Cucumber Spread
recipes.description: Creamy shrimp spread with fresh cucumber and a hint of catsup.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl stir together cream cheese, mayonnaise or salad dressing, catsup, mustard, and garlic powder.
Stir in shrimp, cucumber, and onion.
Spread mixture over melba toast or crackers.

notes: Cut bread into decorative shapes with small cookie cutters if desired

recipes.title: Nutty Cheese Spread
recipes.description: Stuff some celery sticks with this creamy spread and add them to a relish tray.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl bring cream cheese and Swiss or cheddar cheese to room temperature.
Add walnuts, milk, parsley, and onion powder. Stir till combined.
Cover and chill up to 24 hours.
To serve, spread on celery sticks, apple slices, crackers, or melba toast rounds.

notes: Brush apple slices with lemon juice to prevent browning

recipes.title: Curried Chicken Spread
recipes.description: Curry powder and sour cream turn ordinary chicken salad into a tasty topping for party bread.

instructions.text: In a medium mixing bowl combine mayonnaise or salad dressing, sour cream, green onion, nuts, curry powder, and salt.
Stir in chicken.
Spread chicken mixture over bread (or chill up to 24 hours before spreading). Sprinkle with parsley, if desired.

recipes.title: Avocado Pita Wedges
recipes.description: Avocado and mozzarella cheese make a great team in these minisandwiches.

ingredients.item: small whole wheat or white pita bread rounds

instructions.text: Cut each pita bread round into quarters. Spread the inside of each with mayonnaise.
Peel and seed avocado. Cut half of the avocado into 6 slices. (Reserve remaining avocado for another use.) Cut each slice in half crosswise.
Toss together cheese, tomato, and carrot. Spoon into each pita quarter.
Place an avocado piece in each. Top with alfalfa sprouts. Secure with toothpicks, if necessary.

recipes.title: Cocktail Meatballs
recipes.description: Party meatballs with choice of three sauces: Tangy Cranberry, Dill, or Polynesian.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, parsley, mustard, salt, and pepper. Add beef. Mix well.
Shape into 1-inch meatballs. Place in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till done. Drain.
Meanwhile, prepare Tangy Cranberry Sauce, Dill Sauce, or Polynesian Sauce. Add meatballs; heat through.

notes: Tangy Cranberry Sauce: Combine 8-oz can jellied cranberry sauce, 2 tbsp steak sauce, 1 tbsp brown sugar. Heat.
Dill Sauce: Melt 2 tbsp butter, stir in 2 tbsp flour, 1 tsp beef bouillon, dash nutmeg, dash pepper. Add 3/4 cup water. Thicken. Add 3/4 cup light cream and 1 tsp dried dillweed.

Polynesian Sauce: Drain 15 1/4-oz can pineapple chunks (save juice + water to make 1 cup). Combine with 2 tbsp catsup, 2 tbsp vinegar, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1/2 tsp beef bouillon, dash red pepper. Thicken. Add pineapple and 1 sliced pepper.

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Franks
recipes.description: Cocktail franks in a tangy maple and citrus sauce with pearl onions.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine syrup, juice, vinegar, cornstarch, Worcestershire sauce, and mustard. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Stir in frankfurters and onions. Cook, stirring occasionally, 8 minutes or till onions are tender.

notes: Microwave option available

recipes.title: Mustard-Glazed Ribs
recipes.description: For easier eating, ask your butcher to saw the ribs in half across the bones.

ingredients.item: meaty pork loin back ribs or spareribs

instructions.text: Cut ribs into single-rib portions. In a bowl combine 2 tablespoons brown sugar, paprika, turmeric, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Rub mixture over ribs.
Roast ribs, meaty side up, in a shallow roasting pan in a 350° oven for 1 hour.
For sauce, in a saucepan combine the remaining brown sugar, onion, vinegar, mustard, celery seed, and garlic powder. Bring to boiling, stirring till sugar dissolves.
Drain fat from pan. Brush ribs with sauce. Roast 30 to 45 minutes more or till done, brushing frequently with sauce.

recipes.title: Barbecue-Style Chicken Wings
recipes.description: Provide lots of napkins with these saucy wings.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Cut off and discard wing tips. Cut each wing at joint to make 2 sections.
Place the wing pieces in a single layer in a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake in a 375° oven for 20 minutes. Drain fat from baking pan.
For sauce, combine remaining ingredients. Brush wings with sauce. Bake 10 minutes.
Turn wings over; brush again with sauce. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes or till chicken is tender.

notes: Microwave option available

recipes.title: Rumaki
recipes.description: If you like chicken livers, you'll love these classic bacon-wrapped appetizers.

instructions.text: Combine wine, soy sauce, oil, sugar, garlic powder, ginger, and 1/4 cup water. Stir in livers and water chestnuts. Cover; chill 4 to 24 hours.
Cook bacon slightly. Drain. Drain livers and water chestnuts.
Wrap a bacon piece around a liver half and a water chestnut slice. Secure with a wooden toothpick.
Broil 4 inches from heat for 6 to 8 minutes or till livers are no longer pink; turn once. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Cheese Twists
recipes.description: These pastry snacks go great alone or with salads.

ingredients.item: toasted sesame seed or poppy seed

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine flour, garlic powder, salt, and, if desired, red pepper. Cut in cheese and margarine or butter till pieces are the size of small peas.
Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the water over part of the mixture. Gently toss with a fork. Push to side of bowl. Repeat till all of flour mixture is moistened. Shape dough into a ball.
On a lightly floured surface, flatten dough with hands. Roll out dough from center to edges, forming a 10-inch square.
Brush with egg. Sprinkle with sesame seed or poppy seed. Cut dough into 5x1/2-inch strips. Twist each strip.
Place on lightly greased baking sheets. Bake in a 400° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till golden brown. Serve warm or cool.

notes: Herbed Parmesan Twists: Omit red pepper. Add 1/4 tsp crushed dried oregano. Substitute Parmesan cheese for sesame seed.
Swiss-Caraway Twists: Substitute Swiss cheese for cheddar and caraway seed for sesame seed.

recipes.title: Pastry-Wrapped Olives
recipes.description: Easy cheese pastry wrapped around olives for a simple appetizer.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine 1 stick piecrust mix, 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese, and a dash ground red pepper. Prepare piecrust dough according to package directions.
Pat 30 pitted ripe or pimiento-stuffed olives dry with paper towels.
Shape about 1 teaspoon of the dough around each olive. Place on a baking sheet.
