instructions.text: In a small heavy saucepan combine the 1/4 cup sugar and the water. Cook and stir over medium-low heat till sugar dissolves. Add chocolate; cook and stir over low heat till chocolate melts. Gradually stir the chocolate mixture into beaten egg yolks. Return mixture to saucepan. Bring to a gentle boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Cool to lukewarm, stirring occasionally.

In a bowl beat egg whites and cream of tartar with an electric mixer on high speed till soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add the 2 tablespoons sugar, beating till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Pour the lukewarm chocolate mixture over beaten egg whites; fold in gently.

Beat the 1/2 cup whipping cream till soft peaks form; fold whipped cream into the chocolate and egg white mixture. Spoon into dessert dishes. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours before serving. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate curls or grated chocolate, if desired. Serves 5 or 6.

Microwave directions: In a 2-cup measure micro-cook the 1/4 cup sugar and the water, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 1 to 2 minutes or till sugar dissolves. Stir in chocolate. Cook, uncovered, on high for 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 minutes more or till chocolate melts. Stir; cook for 30 to 60 seconds more or till the mixture is smooth. Place beaten yolks in a small bowl. Stir in the chocolate mixture. Cook, uncovered, on high for 30 to 60 seconds or just till mixture bubbles. Cool to lukewarm. Continue as above.

notes: Mocha Mousse: Prepare as above, except add 1 teaspoon instant coffee crystals to the sugar-water mixture before cooking.
Mint-Chocolate Mousse: Prepare as above, except stir 1 tablespoon crème de menthe or a few drops mint extract into the 1/2 cup whipping cream before whipping.

recipes.title: Chocolate Soufflé
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 129

instructions.text: Butter the sides of a 2-quart soufflé dish. Sprinkle sides with a little sugar. Set aside.

In a small saucepan melt margarine. Stir in flour. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add chocolate; stir till melted. Remove from heat. Gradually stir chocolate mixture into beaten egg yolks. Set aside.

Beat egg whites and vanilla till soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Fold about 1 cup beaten whites into chocolate mixture. Then fold chocolate mixture into remaining beaten whites. Transfer to prepared dish. Bake in a 350° oven 35 to 40 minutes or till a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Serve at once with whipped cream, if desired. Serves 6.

notes: Amaretto Soufflé: Prepare as above, except omit chocolate pieces. Stir 1/4 cup amaretto and 1/4 cup finely chopped toasted almonds into the thickened milk mixture.

recipes.title: Baked Alaska
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 129

instructions.text: Stir ice cream to soften. Spoon into a 1 1/2-quart bowl lined with clear plastic wrap. Invert ice cream onto cake; remove bowl. Freeze till firm.

For meringue, beat egg whites, vanilla, and cream of tartar till soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add sugar, beating till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Transfer cake and ice cream to a baking sheet; remove plastic wrap. Spread meringue over all, sealing edge to baking sheet.
Place oven rack in the lowest position. Bake in a 500° oven for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden. Serve immediately. Makes 8 servings.

recipes.title: Cheesecake Supreme
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 130
recipes.description: Your cheesecake is done when its center appears nearly set but jiggles slightly when gently shaken.

instructions.text: For crust, combine crushed crackers, nuts, and cinnamon. Stir in margarine or butter. Reserve 1/4 cup of the crumb mixture for topping, if desired. Press remaining onto bottom and about 2 inches up sides of an 8- or 9-inch springform pan.

In a mixer bowl combine cream cheese, sugar, flour, vanilla, and, if desired, lemon peel. Beat with an electric mixer till fluffy. Add eggs and yolk all at once, beating on low speed just till combined. Stir in milk. Pour into crust-lined pan. Sprinkle with reserved crumbs, if any. Place on a shallow baking pan in oven. Bake in a 375° oven for 45 to 50 minutes for the 8-inch pan (35 to 40 minutes for the 9-inch pan) or till center appears nearly set when shaken. Cool 15 minutes. Loosen crust from sides of pan. Cool for 30 minutes more; remove sides of pan. Cool completely. Chill at least 4 hours. Serve with Fruit Sauce, if desired. Makes 12 to 16 servings.

notes: Sour Cream Cheesecake: Prepare as above, except reduce cream cheese to 2 packages and omit the milk. Add three 8-ounce cartons dairy sour cream with the eggs. Bake in 8-inch pan about 55 minutes (9-inch pan, 50 minutes).
Liqueur Cheesecake: Prepare as above, except substitute white crème de menthe, crème de cacao, coffee liqueur, or amaretto for milk.

Chocolate Swirl Cheesecake: Prepare as above, except omit lemon peel. Stir 2 squares (2 ounces) semisweet chocolate, melted and cooled, into half of the batter. Pour half of each batter mixture into crust; repeat. Use a spatula to gently swirl batters.

recipes.title: Strawberry Shortcake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 130
recipes.description: Next time, try sliced peaches instead of berries. (Strawberry Shortcake is pictured on page 121.)

instructions.text: Stir together berries and 1/4 cup of the sugar; set aside. Stir together remaining sugar, flour, and baking powder. Cut in margarine till mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Combine egg and milk; add all at once to dry ingredients. Stir just to moisten. Spread into a greased 8x1 1/2-inch round baking pan, building up edge slightly. Bake in a 450° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Split into 2 layers. Spoon the fruit and Whipped Cream between layers and over top. Serve immediately. Serves 8.

recipes.title: Brownie Pudding Cake
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 130

instructions.text: Stir together flour, the 1/4 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon of the cocoa powder, and the baking powder. Add milk, oil, and vanilla. Stir till smooth. Stir in nuts. Transfer batter to a 1-quart casserole. Combine the 1/3 cup sugar and remaining cocoa powder. Gradually stir in boiling water. Pour evenly over batter. Bake in a 350° oven about 30 minutes or till a toothpick inserted into cake comes out clean. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Mocha Brownie Pudding Cake: Prepare as above, except add 2 teaspoons instant coffee crystals with the boiling water.

instructions.text: Pop the popcorn. Place in lightly greased sink or large bowl. Combine sugar, butter (or margarine), cream of tartar, and syrup in saucepan. Bring to boil and cook 5 minutes. Remove from heat, add soda. Pour and mix quickly over popcorn.

Place immediately the popcorn mixture into lightly greased pan(s) or onto lightly greased cookie sheet(s). Set in prewarmed oven at 200° for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes. Store in airtight container.
Melt chips separately. Add 1 can of noodles to each bowl of chips. Mix carefully. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 375°. Wash and core apples - Red Delicious. Remove a 1 inch strip from around the top of each apple. Cut the bottoms of the apple so that they will stand up straight in a pan. Mix cinnamon with brown sugar. Fill each apple with 1 teaspoon butter and 1 or 2 tablespoons of sugar mixture. Place apples in baking dish and pour 1 cup of water into the dish around the base of the apples.
Bake for 45 to 60 minutes; cool before serving. Serves 6.
Cook in double boiler for 1 hour. Stir often.

ingredients.item: garlic powder or grated garlic toes

ingredients.prep_note: use less if using soy sauce

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in a small saucepan. Stir over gentle heat until mixed. Heat only until hot, letting the sauce boil will cause the oil in the peanut butter to separate. A little more water may be added for desired consistency. Serve over Sate, grilled meats, and or rice.

Combine sugar, peanuts, syrup, water, and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring continuously, until peanuts are brown (hard crackle stage). Add soda and stir well. Pour into buttered pan. Break into pieces when cool.
Mix sugar and milk in saucepan and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in rest of the ingredients. Beat well with a greased, wooden spoon. Quickly pour into ungreased 9x13 inch pan.

ingredients.item: chocolate or butterscotch chips (or 1/2 cup each)

instructions.text: In large bowl with lid, pour in Rice Chex. Melt chips, butter, and peanut butter. Pour melted mixture over Rice Chex. Mix carefully so you don't break Rice Chex. Pour in powdered sugar. Cover container with lid and shake until coated.

recipes.title: Creamy Poached Eggs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 143

ingredients.item: cream cheese with chives, cut up

instructions.text: Toast muffins or bagels. In a medium skillet combine cheeses, milk, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Cook and stir over medium heat till cheeses melt.

Break 1 egg into a cup. Carefully slide egg into cheese mixture. Repeat with remaining eggs. Cover; cook over medium-low heat for 3 to 5 minutes or to desired doneness. Top each muffin or bagel half with an egg. Stir cheese mixture with a wire whisk. Spoon over eggs. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Poached Eggs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 144
recipes.description: Eggs Benedict (pictured below right) makes a spectacular brunch entrée.

instructions.text: Lightly grease a saucepan, if desired, using a 2-quart pan for 3 or 4 eggs or a 1-quart pan for 1 or 2 eggs. Add water to half-fill the pan; stir in bouillon granules, if desired. Bring water to boiling. Reduce heat to simmering (bubbles should begin to break the surface of the water).

Break 1 egg into a measuring cup. Carefully slide egg into simmering water, holding the lip of the cup as close to the water as possible. Repeat with remaining eggs, allowing each egg an equal amount of space.
Simmer eggs, uncovered, for 3 to 5 minutes or to desired doneness. Remove with a slotted spoon. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

notes: Eggs Benedict: Prepare as above, except, before poaching eggs, split 2 English muffins. Place muffin halves and 8 slices Canadian-style bacon on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350° oven for 10 to 15 minutes or till muffins are toasted and bacon is hot. Keep warm. Place 4 poached eggs in a large pan of warm water to keep warm while preparing half of a recipe of Hollandaise Sauce (see recipe, page 362) or half of a recipe of Mock Hollandaise Sauce (see recipe, page 363). To serve, top each muffin half with 2 slices of bacon and an egg; spoon sauce over eggs. Sprinkle with paprika and garnish with orange slices and parsley, if desired. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Huevos Rancheros
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 145
recipes.description: Featuring poached eggs and tortillas topped with a chili-pepper-spiked sauce. Huevos Rancheros (WEH-vohs rahn-CHEH-rohs) is one hot dish.

ingredients.item: canned diced green chili peppers, rinsed
shredded Monterey Jack, Monterey Jack with jalapeño peppers, or American cheese

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook chopped onion in the 1 tablespoon oil till tender. Stir in undrained tomatoes, chili peppers, chili powder, and garlic powder. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 to 10 minutes or till slightly thickened.
Meanwhile, place tortillas on a baking sheet; brush lightly with the 1 teaspoon oil. Bake in a 350° oven about 10 minutes or till crisp.
Break 1 egg into a measuring cup. Carefully slide egg into simmering tomato mixture. Repeat with remaining eggs. Simmer gently, covered, for 3 to 5 minutes or to desired doneness.
To serve, place tortillas on 3 plates. Top each tortilla with 2 eggs; spoon tomato mixture over eggs. Sprinkle with cheese. Pass hot pepper sauce. Makes 3 servings.

recipes.title: Deviled Eggs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 146
recipes.description: Four different flavors to choose from.

instructions.text: Halve hard-cooked eggs lengthwise and remove yolks. Place yolks in a bowl; mash with a fork. Add mayonnaise, mustard, and vinegar; mix well. Season with salt and pepper, if desired. Stuff egg white halves with yolk mixture. Garnish with paprika or parsley, if desired. Makes 12 servings.

notes: Italian-Style Deviled Eggs: Prepare as above, except omit mayonnaise, mustard, and vinegar. Add 1/4 cup creamy Italian salad dressing and 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese to mashed yolks; mix well.
Indian-Style Deviled Eggs: Prepare as above, except omit mustard and vinegar. Add 1/4 cup finely chopped peanuts and 1/2 teaspoon curry powder to yolk mixture; mix well.

Mexican-Style Deviled Eggs: Prepare as above, except omit mustard and vinegar. Add 2 tablespoons canned diced green chili peppers, 1 tablespoon chopped pitted ripe olives, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, and 1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper to yolk mixture; mix well. Stuff egg whites with yolk mixture. Garnish with sliced pitted ripe olives or cilantro and serve with salsa, if desired.

recipes.title: Fried Eggs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 146
recipes.description: No need to turn the eggs with this simple method.

ingredients.item: margarine or butter, or nonstick spray coating

instructions.text: In a large skillet melt margarine or butter over medium heat. (Or, spray a cold skillet with nonstick spray coating, then heat.) Add eggs. When whites are set, add 1 teaspoon water. Cover skillet; cook eggs to desired doneness (about 2 minutes for soft or 4 minutes for firm). Makes 2 servings.
Note: For 1 or 2 eggs, use a small skillet and 1 teaspoon margarine or butter.

recipes.title: Baked Eggs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 147
recipes.description: Same great poached-egg taste, but less work.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar, Swiss, or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Generously grease three 10-ounce casseroles with margarine. Carefully break 2 eggs into each casserole; sprinkle with salt, pepper, and chives or herb. Set casseroles into a 13x9x2-inch baking pan; place on an oven rack. Pour hot water around casseroles in pan to a depth of 1 inch.

Bake in a 325° oven about 25 minutes or till eggs are firm and whites are opaque. If desired, after 20 minutes of cooking, sprinkle cheese atop eggs. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes more or till eggs are cooked and cheese melts. Serves 3.

recipes.title: Scrambled Eggs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 148

instructions.text: In a bowl beat together eggs, milk or light cream, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper. In a large skillet melt margarine over medium heat; pour in egg mixture. Cook, without stirring, till mixture begins to set on the bottom and around edge.

Using a large spoon or spatula, lift and fold partially cooked eggs so uncooked portion flows underneath. Continue cooking over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes or till eggs are cooked throughout but are still glossy and moist. Remove from the heat immediately. Serves 3.

notes: Herbed Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except add 1 tablespoon snipped parsley and 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme, crushed, to the beaten egg mixture.
Cream-Cheese Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except add one 3-ounce package cream cheese with chives, cut into small cubes, to the beaten egg mixture.

Cheese-Onion Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except cook 1 green onion, sliced, in margarine 30 seconds. Then add egg mixture. Add 1/2 cup shredded American cheese after eggs begin to set. Do not use microwave directions.

Mushroom Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except increase margarine to 2 tablespoons. Cook 1/2 cup sliced fresh mushrooms and 1 tablespoon chopped onion in margarine. Add 1 tablespoon snipped parsley, 1/2 teaspoon dry mustard, and 1/4 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce to beaten egg mixture. Do not use the microwave directions.

Denver Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except omit salt and increase margarine to 2 tablespoons. In the skillet cook 1/3 cup diced fully cooked ham; 1/4 cup chopped onion; one 2-ounce can mushroom stems and pieces, drained; and 2 tablespoons finely chopped green pepper in margarine. Then add egg mixture. Do not use the microwave directions.

recipes.title: Farmer's Breakfast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 148
recipes.description: For a quicker breakfast, substitute frozen hash brown potatoes for the fresh potatoes.

ingredients.item: medium potatoes, peeled and finely chopped

instructions.text: In a large nonstick or well-seasoned skillet cook potatoes and onion in margarine over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or till tender; stir often.

Beat together eggs, milk, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper; stir in ham. Pour over potato mixture. Cook, without stirring, till mixture begins to set on the bottom and around edge. Using a large spoon, lift and fold partially cooked egg mixture so uncooked portion flows underneath. Continue cooking about 4 minutes or till eggs are cooked throughout but still glossy and moist. Serves 4.

recipes.title: French Omelet
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 150
recipes.description: The Vegetable French Omelet with zucchini and cheddar cheese is pictured below right.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine eggs, water, salt, and dash pepper. Using a fork, beat till combined but not frothy. In an 8- or 10-inch skillet with flared sides, heat margarine or butter till a drop of water sizzles. Lift and tilt the pan to coat the sides.

Add egg mixture to skillet; cook over medium heat. As eggs set, run a spatula around the edge of the skillet, lifting eggs and letting uncooked portion flow underneath. When eggs are but still shiny, remove from the heat. Fold omelet in half. Transfer onto a warm plate. Serves 1.

notes: Mushroom French Omelet: Prepare as above, except, for filling, cook 1/2 cup sliced fresh mushrooms in 1 tablespoon margarine till tender. Spoon across center of omelet. Fold sides over.

Cheese French Omelet: Prepare as above, except omit salt. For filling, sprinkle 1/4 cup shredded cheddar, Swiss, Monterey Jack, or American cheese across center of omelet. Fold sides over. Top with shredded cheese and snipped parsley.

Fruited French Omelet: Prepare as above, except, for filling, spread 2 tablespoons dairy sour cream or yogurt across center of omelet. Fold sides over. Top omelet with 1/4 cup halved strawberries; sliced, peeled peaches; or blueberries. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon brown sugar.

Vegetable French Omelet: Prepare as above, except, for filling, cook 1/3 cup vegetables (combination of sliced asparagus, sliced zucchini, sliced green onion, sliced celery, or chopped green pepper) and 1/8 teaspoon dried basil, crushed, in 1 tablespoon margarine. Spoon filling across center of omelet. Sprinkle grated Parmesan, shredded cheddar, or crumbled feta cheese atop filling before folding omelet.

recipes.title: Denver Omelet
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 150
recipes.description: Chock-full of bright garden vegetables and ham. (Pictured on page 141.)

ingredients.item: fully cooked ham, cut into strips

instructions.text: Prepare Puffy Omelet (see recipe, opposite). Prepare filling while omelet is baking.

For filling, in a skillet melt 2 tablespoons margarine or butter. Add 1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms; 1 medium green pepper, chopped; 4 green onions, bias sliced; and 1/2 teaspoon dried basil, crushed. Cook till tender but not brown. Stir in 3 ounces fully cooked ham, cut into 1/4-inch-long strips (1/2 cup), and 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved. Heat through. Remove omelet from the oven. Fill omelet with ham mixture before folding. Makes 2 or 3 servings.

recipes.title: Choose-a-Flavor Quiche
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 154
recipes.description: Mix and match the meat and cheese to suit your fancy, or rely on the classic bacon and Swiss cheese combination in Quiche Lorraine.

ingredients.item: chopped cooked chicken, crabmeat, or ham
shredded Swiss, cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Havarti cheese

instructions.text: Prepare Pastry for Single-Crust Pie. Line the unpricked pastry shell with a double thickness of heavy-duty foil. Bake in a 450° oven for 5 minutes. Remove foil. Bake for 5 to 7 minutes more or till pastry is nearly done. Remove from the oven. Reduce oven temperature to 325°.
Meanwhile, in a bowl stir together eggs, milk, onion, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Stir in chicken, crabmeat, or ham. Toss together shredded cheese and flour. Add to egg mixture; mix well.

Pour egg mixture into hot pastry shell. Bake in the 325° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. If necessary, cover edge of crust with foil to prevent overbrowning. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serves 6.

notes: Quiche Lorraine: Prepare as above, except omit green onion and chicken, crabmeat, or ham. Cook 6 slices bacon till crisp. Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Crumble bacon; set aside. Cook 1 medium onion, sliced, in drippings over medium heat till tender; drain. Add bacon, onion, and Swiss-cheese-flour mixture to egg mixture.

Individual Quiche Casseroles: Prepare as above, except omit pastry and chicken, crabmeat, or ham. Pour egg mixture into four 10-ounce custard cups. Place custard cups in a 13x9x2-inch baking pan on an oven rack. Pour boiling water around cups in the pan to a depth of 1 inch. Bake in a 325° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till a knife inserted near centers comes out clean. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Breakfast Pizza
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 155

ingredients.prep_note: sliced ripe olives, avocado, green onion, mushrooms, or tomato

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar, Swiss, or mozzarella cheese
diced fully cooked ham or cooked turkey or chicken

instructions.text: For crust, unroll 1 package (8) refrigerated crescent rolls; separate into triangles. Place triangles on a lightly greased 12-inch pizza pan with points toward center. Press triangles together to cover bottom and 1/2 inch up sides of pan. Bake in a 375° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till lightly browned. (Do not remove crust from the oven.)

Meanwhile, combine 5 beaten eggs; 1/4 cup milk; 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano, crushed; and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. When crust is lightly browned, leave on oven shelf (if necessary, press down any high spots in crust). Carefully pour egg mixture onto crust. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes more or till egg mixture is almost set.
Sprinkle with 1 1/2 cups desired vegetables (sliced pitted ripe olives; sliced avocado, green onion, or mushrooms; or chopped tomato).

Sprinkle with 1 1/2 cups shredded cheddar, Swiss, or mozzarella cheese; diced fully cooked ham; or chopped cooked turkey or chicken. Return to the oven and bake 3 to 5 minutes more or till cheese melts. Cut into wedges. Serves 6.

recipes.title: Fettuccine with Cheese Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 158
recipes.description: Elegant for entertaining.

ingredients.item: packaged fettuccine, linguine, or egg noodles
shredded process Swiss, Gruyère, or American cheese

instructions.text: Cook fettuccine according to package directions (or see chart, page 278); drain well.

Meanwhile, for cheese sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, bouillon granules, and the 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till slightly thickened and bubbly. Add shredded cheese; stir till melted.
Stir in cheese. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Stir in parsley. If cheese sauce is too thick, stir in 1 to 2 tablespoons additional milk.
Serve cheese sauce over hot cooked pasta. Sprinkle with freshly ground pepper. Serves 4.

notes: Fettuccine with Broccoli and Cheese Sauce: Prepare as above, except add one 10-ounce package frozen chopped broccoli to pasta after it has simmered for 5 minutes.

Fettuccine with Asparagus and Swiss Cheese Sauce: Prepare as above, except add one 10-ounce package frozen cut asparagus to pasta after it has simmered for 5 minutes. For sauce, use the process Swiss cheese. Substitute 2 tablespoons toasted sliced almonds for the freshly ground pepper.

recipes.title: Cheese Fondue
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 158
recipes.description: Also makes a great appetizer.

ingredients.item: coarsely shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese
dippers (cubed French or Italian bread or raw vegetables)

instructions.text: Bring shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese to room temperature. Toss flour with cheese; set aside. Rub inside of a fondue pot with garlic halves; discard garlic. Set pot aside.

In medium saucepan heat wine over medium heat till small bubbles rise to surface. Just before wine boils, reduce heat to low and stir in cheese mixture, a little at a time, stirring constantly and making sure cheese melts before adding more. Stir till mixture bubbles gently.
Stir in kirsch or sherry, nutmeg, and pepper. Transfer cheese mixture to the fondue pot; keep mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner. Serve with bread cubes or raw vegetables. Makes 5 servings.

notes: Onion-Cheese Fondue: Prepare as above, except stir 1/2 cup sliced green onion and 1/2 cup shredded carrot into the cheese mixture with the kirsch or sherry.
*Note: For a milder flavor, substitute 1/4 cup chicken broth or water for 1/4 cup of the wine.

recipes.title: Cheese Strata
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 159

instructions.text: In a greased 8x8x2-inch baking dish layer 8 bread-slice halves, the cheese slices, then the remaining bread-slice halves. Beat eggs; stir in milk, onion, mustard, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Pour over bread and cheese layers. Sprinkle with paprika. Cover; chill in the refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours. Bake, uncovered, in a 325° oven for 45 to 50 minutes or till set and lightly browned. Let stand 10 minutes. Serves 6.

notes: Vegetable Cheese Strata: Prepare as above, except layer 1 cup chopped cooked broccoli or carrot atop cheese slices.
Meat Cheese Strata: Prepare as above, except layer 1 cup diced fully cooked ham or 1 cup diced cooked chicken or turkey atop cheese slices. (If using ham, omit salt.)

recipes.title: Macaroni and Cheese
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 160
recipes.description: For homemade flavor in a hurry, try the Shortcut Macaroni and Cheese.

instructions.text: Cook macaroni according to package directions (or see chart, page 278); drain well.

Meanwhile, for cheese sauce, in a saucepan cook onion in margarine or butter till tender but not brown. Stir in flour and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till slightly thickened and bubbly. Add shredded cheese; stir till melted.

Stir macaroni into cheese sauce. Transfer to a 1-quart casserole. Bake, uncovered, in a 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till bubbly. During the last 5 minutes of baking, arrange tomato slices atop macaroni, if desired. Let stand 10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Vegetable Macaroni and Cheese: Prepare as above, except stir 2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, thawed, or one 16-ounce can mixed vegetables, drained, into cheese sauce with macaroni. Transfer to a 1 1/2-quart casserole.

Shortcut Macaroni and Cheese: Prepare as above, except immediately return the drained macaroni to the saucepan it was cooked in. Pour the cheese sauce over the macaroni; mix well. Cook over low heat for 3 to 5 minutes or till heated through, stirring frequently. Let stand for 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Welsh Rarebit Breakfast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 160
recipes.description: The tangy cheese sauce also is good served over broccoli, cauliflower, and burgers.

ingredients.item: English muffins, split and toasted, or slices bread, toasted
slices Canadian-style bacon, warmed, or 4 poached eggs

instructions.text: For English muffin or toast stacks, place muffin halves or toast slices on plates. Top each with a slice of Canadian-style bacon, then a tomato slice; or, if using poached eggs, top muffins or toast with tomato slices, then eggs. Set aside.
For cheese sauce, in a heavy medium saucepan combine cheese, milk, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and red pepper. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, till cheese melts.
Slowly stir about half of the hot cheese sauce into beaten egg; return all to the saucepan. Cook and stir over low heat till cheese sauce thickens slightly and just bubbles.
Serve cheese sauce immediately over English muffin or toast stacks. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Beer Rarebit: Prepare as above, except substitute 8 slices crisp-cooked bacon, drained and halved crosswise, for the Canadian-style bacon or poached egg. Substitute beer for the milk.

recipes.title: Meatless Red Beans and Rice
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 161
recipes.description: Adjust the amount of ground red pepper to give this dish the zing you like.

ingredients.item: dry red beans or dry red kidney beans

instructions.text: Rinse beans. In a large saucepan combine beans and 3 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand 1 hour. (Or, soak by placing beans and 3 cups water in a bowl. Cover and set in a cool place for 6 to 8 hours or overnight.)

Drain beans in a colander and rinse. Return beans to the saucepan. Stir in onion, garlic, bay leaf, salt, fennel seed, red pepper, and 3 cups fresh water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 2 1/2 hours or till beans are tender, adding more water, if necessary, and stirring occasionally.
Uncover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes more or till a thick gravy forms. Discard bay leaf. Serve over rice. Serves 4.

notes: Meaty Red Beans and Rice: Prepare as above, except omit salt and fennel seed. Add 1/2 pound smoked pork hocks or meaty ham bone with onion. When beans are tender, remove hocks or ham bone. Cut meat from bones or bone. Discard bones or bone and return meat to bean mixture along with 1/2 pound smoked sausage, cut into bite-size pieces.
Red Beans and Corn Bread: Prepare as above, except omit rice and spoon bean mixture over squares of corn bread.

recipes.title: Meatless Tacos
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 162

ingredients.item: tofu (fresh bean curd), drained and finely chopped

instructions.text: Rinse lentils; drain. In a medium saucepan combine lentils, onion, and 1 1/2 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 30 minutes or till tender and liquid is absorbed.
Stir tomato sauce and seasoning mix into lentils. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Stir in tofu; heat through. Spoon into taco shells. Top with lettuce, tomato, cheese, and salsa. Serves 4.

notes: Bulgur Tacos: Prepare as above, except substitute bulgur for lentils. Cover and simmer bulgur, onion, and 3/4 cup water about 10 minutes or till tender and liquid is absorbed.

recipes.title: Bean and Cheese Burritos
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 162

instructions.text: Stack six 8-inch flour tortillas and wrap in foil. Heat in a 350° oven for 10 minutes to soften. In a skillet cook 1 cup chopped onion in 1 tablespoon cooking oil till tender. Add one 16-ounce can refried beans. Cook and stir till heated through.

Spoon about 1/4 cup bean mixture onto each tortilla just below center. Divide 1 1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese among tortillas. Fold edge nearest filling up and over just till mixture is covered. Fold in 2 sides just till they meet; roll up.
Place on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350° oven about 10 minutes or till heated through. Serve with shredded lettuce and salsa. Serves 3.

notes: Bean and Cheese Chimichangas: Prepare as above, except use 10-inch flour tortillas and omit baking. Secure rolled-up tortillas with wooden toothpicks. In a 3-quart saucepan fry tortillas, 2 or 3 at a time, in 1 inch hot cooking oil (375°) about 1 minute on each side or till golden. Drain. Keep warm in a 300° oven. Remove picks. Pass dairy sour cream and guacamole.

recipes.title: Marinated Salmon Steaks
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 167

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen salmon (or halibut) steaks, cut 1 inch thick
finely shredded lemon, lime, or orange peel

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut steaks into serving-size portions. For marinade, in a shallow dish combine juice, oil, lemon peel, Worcestershire sauce, rosemary or thyme, and garlic.
Place fish in marinade. Pour marinade over fish. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes, turning fish once.

Place fish on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Brush with half of the remaining marinade. Broil 4 inches from the heat 5 minutes. Turn fish. Brush with remaining marinade. Broil for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Halibut with Sherry Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen halibut (or other fish) steaks, cut 1 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Place fish on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Brush with half of the margarine, melted. Broil 4 inches from the heat 5 minutes. Turn fish. Brush with remaining margarine. Broil for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

Meanwhile, in a small saucepan cook onions and garlic in the 4 tablespoons margarine or butter till tender. Stir in flour. Add sherry and broth all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Add cheese and beer. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Spoon over fish. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Dijon-Mustard Fillets
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. Place fish on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat till fish flakes easily with a fork. (Allow 4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness. Turn once if more than 1 inch thick.)
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan stir together sour cream, milk, mustard, chives, and a dash pepper. Cook till hot (do not boil). Serve over fish. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Teriyaki Shark
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen shark steaks, cut 1 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Place fish, mushrooms, onions in a plastic bag; set bag into a bowl. Combine oil, wine or orange juice, garlic, orange peel, and marinate at room temperature for 2 hours, turning bag occasionally. Drain fish cubes.

On eight 12-inch skewers alternately thread fish cubes, mushrooms, and onions, leaving about 1/4 inch between pieces. Place on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Turn kabobs over. Broil for 4 to 6 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork. To serve, add a tomato to each skewer. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Orange Swordfish Kabobs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen swordfish steaks, cut 1 inch thick
ingredients.prep_note: tuna or shark makes great kabobs because of their firm, steak-like texture

ingredients.item: large green onions, cut into 2-inch lengths
finely shredded orange or cherry tomatoes

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Place fish, mushrooms, and onions in a plastic bag; set bag in a bowl. Combine oil, wine or orange juice, garlic, orange peel. Seal bag and marinate at room temperature for 2 hours, turning bag occasionally. Drain fish cubes, mushrooms, and onions, reserving marinade.
On eight 12-inch skewers alternately thread fish cubes, mushrooms, and onions, leaving about 1/4 inch between pieces. Place on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan.
Broil 4 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Turn kabobs over. Broil for 4 to 6 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork. To serve, add a tomato to each skewer. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Fish Kabobs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 169

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen swordfish, tuna, or tuna steaks, cut 1 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Cook carrots in a small amount of boiling water for 10 to 12 minutes or till almost tender; drain.
For the sauce, in a small saucepan combine preserves, lemon juice, and oil. Cook over low heat till preserves melt, stirring constantly.

Alternately thread fish cubes, carrot slices, and pineapple chunks on four 8-inch kabobs, leaving about 1/4 inch between pieces. Place kabobs on the greased unheated rack of broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Turn kabobs. Brush with sauce during the last 2 minutes of broiling. Brush again with sauce before serving.

recipes.title: Fish with Beer-Cheese Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets or steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. In a large skillet cook fish in hot oil, uncovered, for 4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness or till fish flakes easily with a fork (turning fish once if fish is 1 inch thick or more). Keep warm.

For sauce, in a saucepan cook onion in margarine till tender. Add flour and, if desired, mustard. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add cheese and beer. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Spoon over fish. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Citrus Baked Halibut
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen halibut steaks, chopped on thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Arrange in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish. Cook orange and garlic in margarine. Stir in parsley and lemon juice. Pour over fish.
Bake in a 400° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Baked Fish with Mushrooms
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets or steaks, cut 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Arrange fish in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with mushrooms, onion, and tarragon. Dot with margarine. Sprinkle with salt and paprika.
Bake, covered, in a 450° oven for 6 to 10 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Broccoli-Stuffed Sole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171

ingredients.item: frozen cut broccoli (or other fish fillets)
cream cheese with chives and onion
white wine or dry white wine

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. For stuffing, cook broccoli according to package directions. Drain. Cut up any large pieces. Combine broccoli and cheeses.
Place stuffing at one end of each fillet. Roll up fish. Secure with wooden toothpicks, if necessary.
Place fish rolls with stuffing side up in a 1-quart casserole; sprinkle with crumbs. Set aside.
In a saucepan cook milk and wine over medium heat, stirring often. Serve over fish. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Fish en Papillote
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 172
recipes.description: En papillote (pah-pee-YOHT) is French for 'in paper.' It's a simple yet elegant way to cook fish.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen skinless pompano, perch, sole, or flounder fish fillets

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut 4 pieces of parchment paper or brown paper into heart shapes, 12 inches wide and 9 inches long.

In a large skillet bring water, lemon slices, bay leaf, and bouillon granules to boiling. Add fish. Simmer, covered, for 4 to 6 minutes or till fish flakes easily. Using a slotted spoon, carefully remove fish.
In a saucepan melt margarine; stir in flour and mustard. Add milk; cook and stir till thickened.

To assemble each packet, place one fillet on half of each parchment heart. Top with one-fourth of the sauce. Fold the other half of the heart over fillet. Starting at the top, seal by turning up edges of heart and folding in twice. At bottom, twist the tip of heart to seal. Place packets on a large baking sheet. Bake in a 400° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till slightly puffed. Transfer to dinner plates. To serve, cut an X in top of each. Pull back the paper. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Chilled Salmon Steaks
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen salmon steaks, cut 1/2 to 3/4 inches thick

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Place steaks in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Add bouillon to boiling water. Pour over fish.

Bake in a 450° oven 8 to 12 minutes or till fish flakes. Remove fish. For marinade, stir in oil, parsley, sweet red pepper, onion, and mustard. Pour over fish. Cover; chill 4 to 24 hours. Shake well. Pour marinade over fish. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Poached Fish with Dill Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. In a fish poacher or a large roasting pan that has a wire rack with handles, add enough water to almost reach the handles. Remove the rack. Add 3 lemon slices, bay leaf, 1/4 teaspoon dried tarragon, crushed, and grease rack; set aside. Add 3 lemon slices over pan top. Cover pan, set over two burners on range; bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Lower fish on rack into pan. Simmer, covered, 35 to 40 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove fish; keep warm. Reserve 1 cup of cooking liquid for the sauce.

For dill sauce, in a saucepan cook 1/4 cup dillweed, snipped; 1/2 teaspoon dried dillweed; 1/4 teaspoon sugar. Cook in 4 tablespoons margarine or butter. Stir in 4 teaspoons all-purpose flour; 1/2 teaspoon dried dillweed. Add reserved liquid, stir about 1/2 cup of the mixture into 1 beaten egg yolk; return to saucepan. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Pass sauce with fish. Serves 6.

recipes.title: Trout Amandine
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 174
recipes.description: The perfect recipe for freshly caught trout. The fillets in your freezer also taste great pan-fried your catch of the day.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen dressed rainbow trout or other fish fillets (about 8 oz each)

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Bone fish if desired. Combine flour and salt.
Coat fish with flour mixture. Dip in egg mixture, then coat with flour mixture again.

In a 12-inch skillet heat oil. Fry fish on one side for 5 to 6 minutes or till golden. Fry fish on the other side for 5 to 6 minutes more or till fish flakes easily. Remove fish; keep warm in a 300° oven while frying remaining fish.
For almond sauce, in a medium saucepan stir together almonds, margarine, and lemon juice over fish. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Pan-Fried Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 174
recipes.description: The crispy coating seals in the fresh fish flavor.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets (1/4 to 1 inch thick)
cornmeal or fine dry bread crumbs
shortening or cooking oil for frying

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. Cut into serving-size portions. Pat dry. In a shallow dish, mix egg and 2 tablespoons water. In another dish, mix cornmeal or bread crumbs, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper. Dip fish into egg mixture, then coat with cornmeal mixture.

In a large skillet heat 1/4 inch melted shortening or oil. Add fish in a single layer. (If fillets have skin, fry skin side last.) Fry fish on one side till golden. Allow 3 to 4 minutes per side for 1/2-inch-thick fillets (5 to 6 minutes per side for 3/4-inch-thick fillets). Turn carefully. Fry till golden and fish flakes easily with a fork. Dry on paper towels. Keep fish warm in a 300° oven while frying remaining fish. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Curried Pan-Fried Fish: Prepare as above, except add 1 tablespoon lemon or lime juice and 2 teaspoons curry powder to cornmeal mixture. Serve with chutney.
Potato-Chip Pan-Fried Fish: Prepare as above, except substitute finely crushed potato chips or saltine crackers for the cornmeal.

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Stir-Fried Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen monkfish steaks, cut into pieces or cubed

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch pieces. Combine pineapple, reserving 2 tablespoons juice.

In a large skillet or wok, combine sugar, cornstarch, reserved pineapple juice, sherry, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, and 1/4 cup water. Add pineapple, cook and stir till bubbly. Stir in fish and green onions. Cook, uncovered, for 3 to 5 minutes or till fish flakes easily. Stir frequently. Remove fish and vegetables.
Serve over hot cooked rice. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Fish and Chips
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175

ingredients.item: shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. For chips, cut 3 peeled medium potatoes lengthwise into 3/8-inch-wide sticks. Pat dry.

In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying to 375°. Fry potatoes in hot fat, about one-third at a time, for 4 to 6 minutes or till lightly browned. Remove from fat. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying fish.

Pat fish dry with paper towels. Cut into serving-size pieces. For batter, combine 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 cup beer or milk, beat till smooth. Dip fish into batter. Fry fish in hot fat, 2 or 3 pieces at a time, about 2 minutes or till golden brown, about 2 minutes on each side or till golden brown. Drain; keep warm in oven while frying remaining fish. Serve with malt or cider vinegar, if desired. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Creamed Tuna
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Stir in tuna. Heat through. Serve over English muffin halves. If desired, sprinkle with almonds. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Hot Tuna Sandwich Cups
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 175

ingredients.item: can tuna, drained and flaked (water pack)

instructions.text: Separate biscuits. Grease the outside of six 6-ounce custard cups. Press one biscuit over bottom and halfway down side of each custard cup, forming a biscuit cup. Place cups, biscuit side up, on a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 400° oven 7 minutes or till lightly browned. Remove biscuits from cups. Place upright in baking pan.

Meanwhile, in saucepan cook celery and onion in margarine till tender. Stir in mayonnaise, mustard, tuna, half of cheese, and the peas. Spoon tuna mixture immediately; remove biscuit from pan. Top with tomato slices and remaining cheese. Bake 2 to 3 minutes more or till cheese melts. Serves 6.

recipes.title: Tuna-Noodle Casserole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 176
recipes.description: Homestyle cooking at its best.

ingredients.item: can condensed cream of mushroom soup
can chunk-style tuna, drained and broken into chunks

instructions.text: Cook noodles according to package directions; drain and set aside. Meanwhile, in a saucepan cook celery and onion in margarine or butter till tender. Stir in tuna or salmon; pimiento. Gently stir in cooked noodles. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Transfer to a 1 1/2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till bubbly. Garnish with parsley sprigs, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Vegetable Tuna-Noodle Casserole: Prepare as above except stir in 1 cup cooked vegetable (such as peas, carrots, or green beans) with the tuna.

Extra-Creamy Tuna-Noodle Casserole: Prepare as above except substitute one 8-ounce carton dairy sour cream or substitute one 8-ounce carton plain yogurt for the milk. Stir 1 to 2 tablespoons milk into mixture, if necessary, to obtain desired consistency.

recipes.title: Tuna-Broccoli Crepes
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 176
recipes.description: Special enough for company.

ingredients.item: can tuna, drained and flaked or one 7 1/2-ounce can salmon, drained, flaked, and skin and bones removed

instructions.text: Cook broccoli according to package directions. Drain. Cut up any large broccoli pieces. Set aside.

For cheese sauce, in a medium saucepan cook onion in margarine or butter till tender but not brown. Stir in flour, mustard, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add cheese. Cook and stir till melted and blended. Remove from heat.

Combine broccoli and 3/4 cup of the tuna sauce. Spoon about 3 tablespoons of the tuna mixture onto the unbrowned side of each crepe; roll up. Place crepes, seam side down, in a 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. Bake, covered, in a 375° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till heated through.

Reheat the remaining cheese sauce. Stir in additional milk, if necessary, to obtain desired consistency. To serve, spoon remaining cheese sauce over crepes. Sprinkle with paprika and, if desired, top with toasted almonds. Makes 6 servings.

recipes.title: Tuna-Biscuit Casseroles
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177
recipes.description: Biscuits are refrigerated biscuits.

instructions.text: Cook onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, bouillon granules, thyme, and pepper. Add milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in vegetables, tuna, and parsley. Heat through.

Spoon mixture into six 10-ounce casseroles or custard cups. Quarter each biscuit. Arrange 6 to 7 pieces atop each casserole. Place on baking sheet. Bake in a 400° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till biscuits are lightly browned. Makes 6 servings.

recipes.title: Salmon Loaf
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177
recipes.description: No time for the sauce? Cook a package of frozen peas and onions to take over the loaf.

ingredients.item: can pink salmon, bones removed, drained and flaked
cans tuna, drained, flaked, and two 6 1/2-ounce cans American cheese slices

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion, dillweed, and a dash pepper in margarine till onion is tender. Combine onion mixture, milk, and egg. Stir in salmon, bread crumbs. Shape mixture into a 6x3-inch loaf in a greased shallow baking pan. Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes. Top with Cheese Sauce or 2 American cheese slices, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Salmon-Pasta Skillet
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177

ingredients.item: pitted ripe olives, cut into cubes

instructions.text: In a large skillet bring chicken broth to boiling. Add pasta. Cook, covered, 15 to 20 minutes or till pasta is tender, stirring frequently. Add broth and salmon. Cook, covered, about 3 more minutes. Stir in cheese, peas, and olives. Cook, covered, about 3 minutes more. Gently stir in salmon. Heat through. Sprinkle with lemon peel. Pass Parmesan cheese. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Crab Cakes
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 179

ingredients.item: crabmeat, cooked, or two 6-ounce cans crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed

instructions.text: In a medium bowl combine egg, mayonnaise, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Stir in crab. Add half of the crumbs (about 3 minutes). Add half of margarine and heat about 3 minutes. Add half of the crab mixture to skillet. Press into four 3-inch patties.
Fry for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or till golden. Remove; keep warm. Repeat with remaining margarine, oil, and crab mixture. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Crab Mornay
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 179
recipes.description: Topped with a classic cheese sauce.

ingredients.item: sliced fresh mushrooms, onion, and celery
crabmeat, cooked, or two 6-ounce cans crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook mushrooms, onion, and celery in margarine till tender. Add red pepper. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in crabmeat and wine. Cook and stir 1 minute more.

Stir in crabmeat, chopped egg, pimiento, to and mustard. Spoon into four 10-ounce casseroles or coquille shells. Top with bread crumbs with the 1 tablespoon margarine; sprinkle over casseroles. Top with almonds. Bake in a 375° oven about 20 minutes or till tops brown. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Deviled Crab
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 179

ingredients.item: crabmeat, cooked, or two 6 1/2-ounce cans crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed

instructions.text: In a saucepan melt the 2 tablespoons margarine. Stir in flour. Add milk and hot pepper sauce all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in crabmeat, chopped egg, pimiento, cheese, and mustard. Spoon into four 10-ounce casseroles or coquille shells. Toss bread crumbs with the 1 tablespoon margarine; sprinkle over casseroles. Top with almonds. Bake in 375° oven about 20 minutes or till tops brown. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Shrimp Creole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 180
recipes.description: This spicy New Orleans classic is the perfect match for rice.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen peeled and deveined shrimp

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. In a large skillet cook onion, celery, green pepper, and garlic in margarine or butter till tender. Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato paste, bay leaf, sugar, paprika, red pepper, and salt. Bring to boiling.
Stir together water and cornstarch. Stir into tomato mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Add shrimp to the tomato mixture. Stir cook, covered, for 1 to 3 minutes or till shrimp turn pink. Remove bay leaf. Serve over rice. Serves 4.

notes: Fish Creole: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces fresh or frozen fish fillets for shrimp. Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fillets into 1-inch pieces. Add fish to the tomato mixture. Cook and stir till the fish is thickened and bubbly. Cook and after 3 to 5 minutes, covered, on high for 1 to 2 minutes or till shrimp turn pink. Remove bay leaf. Serve over rice.

recipes.title: Shrimp Chow Mein
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 180

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen peeled and deveined shrimp
hot cooked rice or chow mein noodles

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. Cut any large shrimp in half lengthwise. For sauce, combine water, soy sauce, cornstarch, bouillon granules, and ginger. Set aside.

Preheat a wok or large skillet over high heat; add cooking oil. (Add more oil as necessary during cooking.) Stir-fry mushrooms, onion, and garlic for 1 minute. Remove. Stir-fry shrimp for 2 to 3 minutes or till shrimp turn pink. Push to side of wok or skillet.

Stir sauce; add to center of wok. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add water chestnuts, bean sprouts, pea pods, and cooked vegetables. Heat ingredients together to coat with sauce. Heat through. Serve over hot cooked rice. Serves 4.

notes: Scallop Chow Mein: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces fresh or frozen scallops for the shrimp. Thaw scallops, if frozen. Cut any large scallops into bite-size pieces. Stir-fry scallops for 2 to 3 minutes or till they turn opaque.

recipes.title: Shrimp in Garlic Butter
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 181

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen peeled and deveined shrimp

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. In a large skillet heat margarine or butter over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 2 to 4 minutes or till shrimp turn pink. Sprinkle with parsley.
Above except for substitute 12 ounces fresh or frozen sea scallops for the shrimp. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Scallops in Garlic Butter: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces fresh or frozen scallops for the shrimp. Cut any large scallops in half. If frozen, thaw scallops. Stir-fry scallops for 3 to 5 minutes or till they turn opaque.

recipes.title: French-Fried Shrimp
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 181
recipes.description: Putting the shrimp dry before dipping them into the batter gives a crisper coating.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen shrimp in shells
shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying

instructions.text: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. Peel shrimp, leaving the last few sections before the tails and the tails intact. To devein shrimp, use a sharp knife to make a shallow slit along the back of each shrimp. Remove the sandy black vein, if present.

To butterfly shrimp, make a deeper slit along the back of shrimp, cutting almost all the way through the shrimp on a flat surface so that the sides open to resemble a butterfly. Rinse; pat dry with paper towels. Set aside.
For batter, combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, and salt. Combine egg, water, and the 2 tablespoons oil. Add to flour mixture. Beat with a rotary beater till smooth.

In a large deep saucepan or deep-fat fryer, heat 2 inches shortening or oil to 375°. Meanwhile, pat shrimp dry. Dip shrimp into batter. Fry shrimp, 5 or 6 at a time, in hot fat for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden. Remove from fat. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying remainder. Serve with Cocktail Sauce, if desired. Makes 6 servings.

recipes.title: Linguine with White Clam Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 182
recipes.description: The nutty rich taste of this alternative recipe is well worth the effort required.

instructions.text: Cook linguine according to package directions. Meanwhile, drain clams, reserving liquid from clams. Add enough of the cream or milk to make 1 cup liquid. Set aside.
In a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, oregano, salt, and pepper. Add the 1 cup liquid. Cook and stir for 1 minute more.
Stir in clams, parsley and wine. Heat through. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Linguine with Red Clam Sauce: Prepare as above, except stir one 15-ounce can tomato sauce and 1/4 cup dry red wine into cooked onion and garlic. Heat through. Serve sauce over linguine. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Coquilles Saint-Jacques
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 182

instructions.text: Thaw scallops, if frozen. Halve any large scallops. In a large skillet, cook mushrooms and onion in the 1/4 cup margarine till tender. Stir in flour and pepper. Add cream. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
In egg yolk; stir about half of the hot mixture into yolk. Return all to skillet. Add scallops. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes or till scallops turn opaque.

Spoon scallop mixture into 4 coquille shells or au gratin dishes or four 10-ounce custard cups. Place together bread crumbs, melted margarine, and parsley; sprinkle over scallops or mixture. Bake in a 400° oven for 7 to 9 minutes or till crumbs are brown. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Crawfish Étouffée
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 183

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen peeled crawfish tails or deveined shrimp

instructions.text: Thaw crawfish tails or shrimp, if frozen. In a large skillet cook onion, celery, green pepper, and garlic in crawfish fat, margarine, or butter for 10 minutes or till tender. Add tomato sauce, red pepper, 1 cup water, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Cook and stir till bubbly.
Add crawfish tails or shrimp. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 4 to 5 minutes or till crawfish are tender (shrimp turn pink). Season to taste. Serve with rice. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Oysters au Gratin
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 183

instructions.text: Pat oysters dry. In a large skillet cook 4 oysters in 1 tablespoon of the margarine for 3 to 4 minutes or till edges curl. Transfer oysters to four 10-ounce casseroles. Drain.

For sauce, in the same skillet cook mushrooms and garlic in the 2 tablespoons margarine till tender. Stir in flour. Add milk and wine all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in parsley, Worcestershire sauce. Spoon over oysters.
Mix crumbs, Parmesan, and melted margarine. Sprinkle over sauce. Bake in 400° oven for 10 minutes or till crumbs are brown. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Creole Stuffed Roast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 228

instructions.text: For stuffing, in a mixing bowl combine onion, green pepper, garlic, celery seed, black pepper, and red pepper. Set aside. Cut tied pork roast and separate. Trim fat. Cut slits along the flat side of one half of roast.

Fill slits with some of the stuffing. Place meat, cut side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer. Roast in a 325° oven for 1 1/4 to 1 3/4 hours. Cover and let stand 15 minutes before carving.

recipes.title: Rice-Stuffed Rib Crown Roast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 228
recipes.description: Sides of ribs form an impressive roast.

ingredients.item: pork rib back ribs (16 to 20 ribs)

instructions.text: To form roast, tie 2 or 3 slabs of ribs together, rib side out and double-bone end up, forming a circle about 5 inches in diameter with crown leaving the inside shallow roasting pan. Rub the inside of the crown. If desired, sprinkle meat thermometer in a 450° oven for 20 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350°. Brush roast.

Meanwhile, for stuffing, in a saucepan combine water, rice, carrot, corn syrup, salt, and the 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Spoon stuffing into crown of roast, transfer meat to a serving platter. Using a fork to steady, cut between the ribs. Make 6 to 8 servings.

notes: Fruit-Stuffed Rib Crown Roast: Prepare as above, except instead of rice stuffing, add one 6-ounce package dried fruit bits and 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon with the rice.

recipes.title: Harvest Pot Roast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 229

ingredients.item: medium acorn squash, peeled and sliced

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. If desired, sprinkle meat with salt and pepper. In Dutch oven brown meat on all sides in hot oil. Drain fat. Add onion, bouillon, bay leaf, 1 1/4 cups water, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 25 to 30 minutes.

Add squash. Cook until meat is done, about 1 hour. Cut squash in half; remove seeds. Cut each half into 4 pieces. Add squash and potatoes to Dutch oven. Simmer 25 to 30 minutes more till vegetables are done.

Transfer meat and vegetables to platter; keep warm. Discard bay leaf. Skim fat from drippings. Measure 1 1/2 cups liquid; return to pan. For gravy, stir 1/4 cup cold water into flour. Stir into pan juices. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly; cook 1 minute more. Serve with meat and vegetables. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Roast Pork with Mushroom-Butter Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 229

ingredients.item: boneless pork roast, rolled and tied

instructions.text: For stuffing, combine mushrooms, onions, and green onions. In a skillet cook mushrooms, salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in margarine till liquid evaporates. Remove from heat. Stir in wine, parsley, lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.

Trim fat from roast. Make 8 pockets, about 1/4 inch deep, in meat. Spoon stuffing into pockets. Place roast, rib side down, in a shallow roasting pan. Insert meat thermometer. Roast in a 325° oven for 2 to 3 hours or till thermometer registers 170°. Cover; let stand 15 minutes before carving. Serve with Mushroom-Butter Sauce.

recipes.title: Pork with Apple-Nutmeg Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 230
recipes.description: Drizzle this tasty cider sauce over meat.

ingredients.item: boneless pork loin center rib roast

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. If desired, sprinkle meat with salt and pepper. Place rib side down, in a shallow roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer. Roast in a 325° oven for 1 1/4 to 1 3/4 hours or till thermometer registers 170° (well-done). Cover and let stand 15 minutes before carving.

For sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in corn, apple, bouillon granules, nutmeg, and pepper. Add apple cider and stir 1 minute. Cook and stir more. Serve sauce over meat. Serves 8 to 10.

recipes.title: Citrus-Glazed Ribs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 230

instructions.text: Cut ribs into serving-size pieces. Place ribs, bone side down, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan.

Roast in a 350° oven for 1 hour. Drain. Meanwhile, for orange combine soy sauce, 2 tablespoons marmalade, lemon juice, and 3/4 teaspoon ground ginger. Roast 30 to 45 minutes more or till well-done. Brush occasionally with glaze. Brush with any remaining glaze before serving. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Barbecue-Style Ribs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 230

instructions.text: Place ribs, bone side down, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Bake in a 350° oven for 1 hour. Drain.

Meanwhile, for sauce, in a small saucepan cook onion and garlic in hot oil till tender. Stir in tomato sauce, mustard, brown sugar, lemon juice, 1/4 cup water, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Simmer, uncovered, for 15 to 20 minutes or till slightly thickened. Stir in ribs. Bake ribs, covered, for 30 to 60 minutes more or till well-done, brushing occasionally with sauce. Pass remaining sauce with ribs. Serves 4.

recipes.title: Braised Steaks Italian
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 230

ingredients.item: pork shoulder blade steaks, cut 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick (2 to 2 1/2 pounds)

instructions.text: Trim fat from meat. In a large skillet brown 2 steaks on each side. Remove steaks from skillet; cook for 2 steaks and remove. Add onion to oil remaining in skillet for 2 minutes. Drain. Add pizza sauce. Return steaks to skillet.

Cover; simmer for low heat about 30 minutes or till no pink remains. Remove steaks. Skim fat from pan juices. If necessary, continue cooking juices to thicken slightly. Spoon over meat. Serve with remaining glaze. Serves 4 to 6.

recipes.title: Corn-Stuffed Pork Chops
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 231
recipes.description: Savory stuffed pork chops stuffed with a buttery corn and vegetable filling.

ingredients.item: pork loin rib chops or pork loin butterfly chops, cut 1 1/4 inches thick (about 2 pounds)
corn-bread stuffing mix or herb-seasoned stuffing mix

instructions.text: Trim fat from chops. Cut a pocket in each chop by cutting from fat side almost to the bone to make a pocket for the stuffing.

For the stuffing, cook vegetables in margarine till tender but not brown, stirring occasionally. In a small saucepan cook onion and green pepper in margarine till tender. Spoon stuffing into pockets with each pork chop. Secure pockets with wooden toothpicks. Place chops on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Cover with foil.
Bake in a 375° oven for 40 to 45 minutes. Uncover; continue cooking for 10 to 15 minutes more or till pork is no pink remains. Remove picks. Makes 4 servings.

recipes.title: Cherry Sourdough Coffee Cake

instructions.text: Mix the 1 1/2 cups flour, the sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cut in 1/3 cup margarine till mixture resembles fine crumbs. Mix Sourdough Starter, egg, and vanilla; add to flour mixture. Stir just till moistened. Spread half of the batter in a greased 9x9x2-inch baking pan.
Spread Cherry Filling atop. Drop remaining batter in small mounds over filling. Mix oats, brown sugar, nuts, and the 3 tablespoons flour. Cut in 1/4 cup margarine; sprinkle over batter.
Bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till golden. Serves 9.

notes: Cherry Filling: Bring 1 1/2 cups fresh or frozen unsweetened pitted tart red cherries to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Combine 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons cornstarch; add to cherry mixture. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Cool completely.

recipes.title: Dill Batter Bread
recipes.description: A no-knead yeast bread with a somewhat coarse texture.

instructions.text: Combine 1 cup flour and the yeast. Heat and stir cottage cheese, sugar, dillseed, margarine, onion, 1/4 cup water, and 1/2 teaspoon salt till warm (120° to 130°) and margarine almost melts. Add to flour mixture along with egg. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on high speed 3 minutes.

Using a spoon, stir in wheat germ and remaining flour (batter will be stiff). Spoon into a well-greased 9x1 1/2-inch round baking pan or a 1-quart casserole. Cover; let rise in a warm place till nearly double (50 to 60 minutes).
Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till golden brown. Remove from pan or casserole. Serve warm or cool. Makes 1 loaf (8 servings).

Cook 3 slices bacon till crisp; drain and crumble. Set bacon aside. Stir together 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup sugar, 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Make a well in the center.

Combine 1 beaten egg, 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 cup Sourdough Starter (see recipe, opposite), and 1/3 cup cooking oil; add to dry mixture all at once. Stir just till moistened. Stir in bacon and 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese.
Grease muffin cups or line with paper bake cups; fill about 3/4 full. Bake in a 400° oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

recipes.title: Cocoa Ripple Ring

instructions.text: In a bowl combine first 3 ingredients. Add milk and oil; beat with an electric mixer on low speed till blended. Beat on high for 2 minutes. Add eggs; beat 2 minutes. Pour 3/4 cup batter into a greased and floured 6-cup fluted tube pan or 6 1/2-cup ring mold.

Mix cocoa powder and nuts; sprinkle half of mixture over batter in pan. Repeat layers. Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Drizzle with Powdered Sugar Glaze. Serves 16.

recipes.pan_size: 6-cup fluted tube pan or 6 1/2-cup ring mold
notes: Powdered Sugar Glaze: In a bowl stir together 1/2 cup sifted powdered sugar, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla, and enough milk to make of drizzling consistency (1 to 2 teaspoons).

recipes.title: Berry Coffee Cake

ingredients.item: packaged biscuit mix or Easy Biscuit Mix

instructions.text: Cut cream cheese and margarine into biscuit mix till crumbly. Add milk; stir till mixed. On lightly floured surface, knead dough 10 to 12 strokes.

On waxed paper, roll or pat dough into a 12x8-inch rectangle. Invert onto a greased baking sheet; remove paper. Spread preserves down center of dough. Make 2 1/2-inch cuts from long sides toward the center at 1-inch intervals. Fold strips alternately over filling.
Bake in a 375° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till golden. Drizzle with Powdered Sugar Glaze. Serve warm. Serves 12.

notes: Powdered Sugar Glaze: In a bowl stir together 1/2 cup sifted powdered sugar, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla, and enough milk to make of drizzling consistency (1 to 2 teaspoons).

recipes.title: Nutty Sticky Rolls
recipes.description: Eat these rolls with a fork so you won't miss a bite of the maple, orange, or chocolate topping.

ingredients.item: light corn syrup or maple-flavored syrup

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine syrup, brown sugar, the 2 tablespoons margarine, and the water. Cook and stir over low heat just till margarine or butter melts; do not boil. Spread onto the bottom of a 9x9x2-inch baking pan. Sprinkle nuts over syrup mixture.

In a mixing bowl stir together flour, baking powder, and salt. Cut in 1/3 cup shortening, margarine, or butter till mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Make a well in center. Add milk all at once; stirring just till dough clings together.

On a lightly floured surface, knead dough gently for 15 to 20 strokes. Roll dough into a 12x10-inch rectangle. Combine 1/4 cup sugar and the cinnamon; sprinkle over dough. Roll up from one of the long sides. Slice into 1-inch pieces. Place, cut side down, atop nuts in the baking pan.
Bake in a 425° oven about 25 minutes or till golden. Immediately loosen sides and invert onto a serving plate. Spoon any topping in pan over rolls. Serve warm. Makes 12.

notes: Orange Sticky Rolls: Prepare as above, except, in the syrup mixture, substitute 1 tablespoon orange juice for the water and add 1 teaspoon finely shredded orange peel. Add 1 teaspoon additional finely shredded orange peel to dough with the milk.

Chocolate Sticky Rolls: Prepare as above, except, in the syrup mixture, omit the 2 tablespoons margarine or butter and add 1/4 cup miniature semisweet chocolate pieces; cook and stir till melted. After sprinkling rolled dough with cinnamon-sugar mixture, sprinkle with 1/4 cup additional miniature semisweet chocolate pieces.

recipes.title: Corn Fritters
recipes.description: Delicious with warm maple-flavored syrup or served plain as a snack or meal accompaniment.

ingredients.item: shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying

instructions.text: Drain corn, reserving liquid. Add enough milk to reserved corn liquid to make 1 cup. In a mixing bowl stir together flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add corn, milk mixture, and beaten egg. Stir just till moistened.
Drop batter by tablespoons, four or five at a time, into deep hot fat (375°). Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or till golden brown, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Repeat. Serve warm. Makes 24.

notes: Apple Fritters: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 cup chopped apple for the corn and use 1 cup milk. Stir 2 tablespoons sugar into flour mixture. Roll hot fritters in a mixture of sugar and ground cinnamon.

recipes.title: Sopaipillas
recipes.description: The secret to puffy sopaipillas (soh-pie-PEE-yahs) is heating the oil to the right temperature.

ingredients.item: shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying

instructions.text: In a bowl combine flour, baking powder, and a dash salt. Cut in shortening till mixture resembles fine crumbs. Gradually add 1/4 cup warm water (110° to 115°), stirring with a fork (dough will be crumbly). On a lightly floured surface, knead dough for 3 to 5 minutes or till smooth. Cover; let rest 10 minutes.
Roll dough into a 12x12x 10-inch rectangle. Using a fluted pastry wheel or knife, cut into 2 1/2-inch squares (do not reroll or patch).

Fry squares, two or three at a time, in deep hot fat (400°) about 30 seconds on each side or till golden. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying remaining squares. Sprinkle with sugar. Serve with honey. Makes 20.

recipes.title: Hush Puppies

ingredients.item: shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying

instructions.text: In a bowl stir together egg, buttermilk or sour milk, and onion. In another bowl combine cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Add egg mixture to cornmeal mixture; stir just till moistened.
Drop batter by tablespoons into deep hot fat (375°). Fry about 3 minutes or till golden, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Makes 14 to 18.

notes: Confetti Hush Puppies: Prepare as above, except add 2 tablespoons diced pimiento and 2 tablespoons snipped parsley to egg mixture. Add 1/8 teaspoon garlic powder to cornmeal mixture.

recipes.title: Mexican Doughnut Strips
recipes.description: Traditionally served with hot chocolate.

ingredients.item: shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying

instructions.text: In a small saucepan bring margarine or butter, 1 1/2 teaspoons sugar, and 1/2 cup water to boiling. Add flour all at once, stirring vigorously with a wooden spoon. Cook and stir till mixture forms a ball that doesn't separate. Remove from heat and cool 10 minutes. Add egg; beat till smooth.
Spoon dough into a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip. Pipe dough into 3x3/4-inch strips onto a baking sheet lined with waxed paper. Freeze 10 to 20 minutes or till paper can be peeled off.
(Do not freeze firm.) Fry, a few at a time, in deep hot fat (375°) for 4 to 5 minutes or till golden, turning occasionally. Drain on paper towels. Roll in sugar. Serve warm. Makes 12.
Line an 8x4x2-inch loaf pan with foil, extending foil over edges of pan. Butter foil; set aside.

Butter the sides of a heavy 2-quart saucepan. In saucepan combine sugar, milk, cream, and corn syrup. Cook and stir over medium-high heat to boiling. Carefully clip a candy thermometer to side of pan. Cook and stir over medium-low heat to 238°, soft-ball stage (25 to 35 minutes).

Remove saucepan from heat. Add margarine and vanilla, but do not stir. Cool, without stirring, to 110°, lukewarm (about 55 minutes). Remove candy thermometer from saucepan. Beat mixture vigorously with a wooden spoon till fudge becomes very thick and just starts to lose its gloss (about 10 minutes total).

Immediately spread fudge into prepared pan. Score into squares while warm. When candy is firm, use the foil to lift it out of the pan; cut into squares. Store tightly covered. Makes about 1 pound (32 servings).

recipes.title: Old-Time Fudge
recipes.description: So rich and creamy, it melts in your mouth.

instructions.text: Line a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan with foil, extending foil over edges of pan. Butter the foil; set aside.

Butter the sides of a heavy 2-quart saucepan. In saucepan combine sugar, milk, chocolate, and corn syrup. Cook and stir over medium-high heat to boiling. Carefully clip a candy thermometer to side of pan. Cook and stir over medium-low heat to 234°, soft-ball stage (20 to 25 minutes).

Remove saucepan from heat. Add margarine and vanilla, but do not stir. Cool, without stirring, to 110°, lukewarm (about 55 minutes). Remove candy thermometer from saucepan. Beat mixture vigorously with a wooden spoon till fudge just begins to thicken. Add chopped nuts, if desired. Continue beating till fudge becomes very thick and just starts to lose its gloss (about 10 minutes total).

Immediately spread fudge into prepared pan. Score into squares while warm. When candy is firm, use foil to lift it out of pan; cut candy into squares. Store tightly covered. Makes about 1 1/4 pounds (32 servings).

Line a 13x9x2-inch baking pan with foil; extend foil over edges. Butter foil; set aside. Butter sides of a heavy 3-quart saucepan. In it, combine sugar, milk, and margarine. Cook and stir over medium-high heat to boiling. Clip candy thermometer to side of pan. Cook and stir over medium heat to 236°, soft-ball stage (about 12 minutes).

Remove saucepan from heat; remove thermometer. Add chocolate pieces, marshmallow creme, nuts, and vanilla; stir till chocolate melts. Spread into pan. Score into squares while warm. When firm, cut into squares. Store in the refrigerator. Makes about 3 1/2 pounds (96 servings).

recipes.title: Penuche
recipes.description: This brown sugar fudge is pictured on page 91.
